Esmeralda is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy merchandise like iron, pipes, cement and wire, among others so that Esmeralda’s business will be well-stocked.  She hopes to increase sales and income this way that she can use to insure her children’s education and wellbeing since she dreams with them becoming good professionals and upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.es: La Sra. Sarah tiene 31 años y es Soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de  sándwiches de chorizo en la feria más populosa de la ciudad de El Alto sus productos son muy solicitados por que son, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sarah va a usar este préstamo para la compra de  mobiliario para la pensión que está iniciando para su negocio,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela y elaborar en mayor cantidad  sus productos e incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias y está muy interesada en la forma en que Kiva trabaja le parece muy noble, la Sra. Sarah enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que ella sigue estudiando en la universidad y también ayuda a su pequeño hermano que depende de ella la Sra. Sarah es una persona muy responsable ya que tiene que hacerse cargo de sus hermanos, su deseo de ella es que quiere salir profesional y tener su propio restaurant y ayudar a su pequeño hermano hasta que salga profesional.
texts.en:
Sarah is 31 years old and is single.  She makes a living selling ‘chorizo’ (seasoned pork sausage) sandwiches in the most populous street market in the city of El Alto.  Her products are very sought after.  

This loan is her first with the institution.  Sarah is going to use this loan to buy furnishings for the eatery that she is going to start for her business.  Her reason for applying for this loan is that she wants to provide greater convenience to her customers and to produce in greater quantity her products and increase her sales and therefore her earnings.  She is very interested in the way in which Kiva works; it seems very noble to her.  

Sarah faces challenges in her business such as continuing to study in the university and also she helps her little brother who depends on her.  Sarah is a very responsible person as she has to take care of her brothers.  Her wish is to become a professional and have her own restaurant and help her little brother until he becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy furnishings for the eatery that she is starting.

loans.name: Abimumbiyehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Jeannette  fait partie du groupe  Abibumbiyehamwe  et habite à Gitega. Elle a 30 ans et est mariée à Ferdinand, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de  6mois  à 9 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, sel, riz,…) depuis  6 mois. Au départ, elle faisait le commerce de la bière locale. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, sel, riz,…), à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Les bénéfices de son commerce lui permettent de soutenir son mari qui vend le service de transport par vélo.
texts.en:
Jeannette is part of the Abibumbiyehamwe group and lives in Gitega.  She is 30 years old and married to Ferdinand, a farmer.  Together they have 5 children, aged 6 months to 9 years.  She has traded in a shop (beans, salt, rice, etc.) for six months, initially selling local beer.  
Jeannette is on her twelfth loan with Turame.  With this Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy many items for her shop (beans, salt, rice, etc.) to resell and earn more.  The profits from her business will allow her to support her husband who runs a bike transport service.

loans.use: to buy beans, salt, and rice

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 29 years old, married with two children who are in school. To earn a living, he sells stationery like pens, books and photocopy paper. He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. Besides this, he does farming to generate more income. Daniel, being a new member of Faulu Kenya, hopes that his business will grow in the future and he will be able to support his family well. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy photocopy paper, pens and books for sale.

loans.use: To buy photocopy paper, pens and books

loans.name: Cascada De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Cascada de Esperanza” está conformado por 29 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, mueblistas, venta de encintados, masajes, joyas, tejidos, venta de perfumes, venta de empanadas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Edith, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blue jeans, polera de color blanca y encima lleva puesto una chaqueta de color café claro, su cabello es largo de color castaño claro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, desde hace 4 meses. Se desempeña en sus labores en las ferias los días martes, miércoles, jueves, sábado y domingos desde las 08ºº hasta las 18ºº horas, cuando no puede trabajar en la feria por problemas de clima, vende chocolates, alfajores y cuchuflis de casa en casa.
La mercadería que va necesitando las compra en la ciudad de Viña del Mar lo que es ropa en bodegas y tiendas de ropa a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un carro para transportar su mercadería, fardos, toldo, colgadores, y algunos materiales para los chocolates.
Una de las metas de Edith es dejar su negocio bien presentable, para que su clientela vea su mercadería con más comodidad, que se vea diferente a como era al principio que no tenía mucha clientela.
Edith vive junto a sus 4 hijos de 22, 17, 12 y 9 años de edad, comenta que sola ha sacado a sus hijos adelante y los tiene a todos estudiando, para que puedan tener una vida diferente. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es poder terminar los detalles de su casa como el piso, los closet de las habitaciones de sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Cascada de Esperanza” (Cascade of Hope) and it has 29 entrepreneurs who are in different lines of work among which are street market merchants, furniture makers, street merchants, massages, jewelry, textiles, perfume sales, turnover sales and services, among others.  All are from the city of Valparaíso.

A communal bank member, Edith, appears in the photo seated in the front row first from right to left wearing jeans, a white shirt and over it a light brown jacket; her hair is long, light brown and she wears it loose.

She’s been selling used clothes for the last four months in street markets on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays from 8am until 6pm.  When she can’t work in the street markets because of the weather, she sells chocolates, sesame cookies and ‘chuchuflis’ [traditional Chilean chocolate-covered sweet] from house to house.

Merchandise she needs she buys in the city of Viña del Mar.  She buys the clothes in warehouses and low-cost clothing stores which is an economic advantage.  She will use the loan to buy a car to transport her merchandise, bundles of clothes, tent, hangers and some materials for the chocolates.

One of Edith’s goals is to make her business quite attractive so that her clientele will be able to see her merchandise more comfortably and that it looks different than how it looked at the beginning when she didn’t have much clientele.

Edith lives with her four children who are 22, 17, 12 and 9 years of age.  She comments that she’s raised her children alone and has all of them in school so that they will be able to have a different life.  Her dream at the family level is to finish some of the details in her house like the floor, and the closets in her children’s bedrooms.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She comments that the training has been fundamental for her business and for her personal development too because she’s learned how to organize and better allocate her income and loans.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It’s the regional capital and also the seat of the country’s legislative power.  It is the nation’s main port and offers a variety of beautiful, picturesque places to visit like the home of Nobel Prize laureate, the poet Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is 49 years old and comes from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with seven children. She helps her carpenter husband in raising their family by selling 'buko' (young coconuts), bananas, buying and selling scrap items and running a fishing business. With her small businesses, Valentina is in need of additional capital that she can use to buy young coconuts, bananas, fishing net and scrap items. Her loan will be her means to help her businesses improve and to cover the needs of her family. In the future, she would like to make her fishing business bigger and include farm produce to expand her business. Her income will be for school fees and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy young coconuts, bananas, fishing net and scrap items

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is married and has five children. Akosua sells 'kenkey', oil, and farm products at Mbeam near Abura, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua uses her income to pay for caring for her children and for paying other household expenses. Akosua will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her 'kenkey' and oil in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akosua plans to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her 'kenkey' (fermented maize balls) and oil in bulk

loans.name: Nasupat

texts.en:
Nasupat is 44 years old. She is married and a  mother of four children aged 17, 14, 10 and three years old.

She has been in the retail business for three years and currently earns a monthly income KES 4,000.The loan will be used to buy stock for the shop, e.g., tea leaves, sugar, flour, soap. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school  fees for her children.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid her loans. Her hopes and dreams are to provide quality education to her children and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop, e.g., tea leaves, sugar, flour.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 51 years old and lives in a small village of Kobuleti district with his large family. His family consists of eight members: his wife, two children (9 and 12 years old), brother, sister-in-law, nephew, and mother. Temur’s mother is a pensioner and works at the clothes factory as well. His wife and sister-in-law work as teachers at the local school and get monthly income. Temur’s brother works as a driver and helps Temur to run their agricultural business. 

Temur has rich experience in his work and tries to do the best for the family. The family owns a large agricultural plot, where citrus and nuts are grown. Temur sells his production at the local open market. 

Besides these activities, he operates an animal husbandry business. In particular, he has a milk cow and a calf. In addition, Temur works as a baker and gets a monthly salary. He works hard, but still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family.

Temur requested a loan to fence his plot of land, build a cattle shed, and repair his house, which is damaged. He will purchase building materials for his house and the cattle shed and use this loan for agricultural expenses. 

Temur will be able to expand his dairy and agricultural business and increase the income of the family. With the increased income, he will be able to finance the education of his children

loans.use: to fence a plot of land and build a cattle shed.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 28 years old and married to Ruth.  They are blessed with a one-year-old baby. 

Willy owns a barber shop, a business he ventured into a year ago, and he earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase two hair driers, a blow-dry machine, hair relaxers, and oil to start a salon business.  

His profit will help him repay his loan and expand his business. His dream is to become a renowned businessman countrywide.

loans.use: To purchase two hair driers, a blow-dry machine, hair relaxers, and oil to start a salon business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells goods made from flour, such as bread, at Mbeam near Abura. She is divorced and has two children. Ama has been selling goods made from flour for 9 years. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy flour in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 33 years old, a mother of one child. She operates a cafeteria to earn a living. She operates her business in a conducive environment and has friendly customers. She has been in the business for seven years and has employed two people. 

Veronicah previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Veronicah has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to open another business.

loans.use: To open another business

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. She is the mother of three children.  

She is investing in a food business in their place. She cooks meals in different dishes. With numerous customers since she started a year ago, her business is thriving.

For now, Mauricia is need of additional capital to further improve her business. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, and seasoning. 

Mauricia believes in hard work and dedication to her livelihood. She hopes to continue expanding her business and to include a different menu that will attract more buyers from her neighborhood. 

Her income will provide food for her family and savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, and seasoning

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 41-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 1 year to 21 years old. She describes herself to be social and a talkative woman. She operates a food stall where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located along a busy street in town  and her primary customers are local residents.

Jackline describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy maize, wheat flour and cooking fat for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to diversify her  business by running a new retail shop  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits made.

loans.use: to buy maize, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Scolah

texts.en:
Scolah is 34 years old, married to Benson, and  blessed with a nine-year-old child.  She runs a cosmetics shop, a business she started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 21,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase hair oil, facial cremes, body cremes and bathing lotions. The profit she earns will aid her to buy additional stock. 

Her dream is to see her business expand so that it is  the leading cosmetics shop in this region.

loans.use: To purchase hair oil, facial cremes, body cremes and bathing lotions.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 28 years old and married with one child. He operates a restaurant to earn a living. He has employed two people in his business. Besides this, he does farming to generate more income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his business because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and opening another outlet in the future. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua sells clothes and farmed goods at Mbeam near Abura. Akua has received an education through Junior Secondary School. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Akua has been selling clothes and farmed goods for three years. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses. 

Her loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 38 years old. She is married to Wambua, and together they have three children aged 16,10 and 7 years.

She has been in the grocery business for four years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). The loan will be used to buy vegetables for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase more vegetables for sale.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams are to diversify her business and to provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer.

Asi sells kenkey (akin to a sourdough dumpling) at Mbeam near Abura, which she has done for six years.  Asi uses her income to care for her children and pay other household expenses. 

Asi will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her kenkey in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Asi plans to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her kenkey in bulk

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 25 years old and a single mother of one child. For a living, she sells wine in a busy environment with reliable customers. She has engaged in this business for three years. Since she became a client of  Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future and creating employment opportunities for people. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy wine for sale.

loans.use: To buy wine.

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio Cesar Eduardo pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. Cesar Eduardo  tiene 25 años y es soltero. El socio Cesar Eduardo trabaja en una empresa privada en el área de marketing utilizando el medio de comunicación de Internet, él está pidiendo un préstamo para uso personal para poder pagar la especialización de la carrera de marketing. 

El socio Cesar Eduardo se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Cesar Eduardo belongs to communal bank 'Minibank', he is from the city of Cusco. Cesar Eduardo is 25 years old and is single. He works in a private company in the marketing department, using the Internet to do his job. He is asking for a personal use loan, to be able to pay for the specialization in marketing degree. Cesar Eduardo is thankful for the opportunity this medium will provide him, and commits to make the repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to be able to afford the specialization degree in marketing

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has eight children. She has received schooling through junior secondary school. Her husband is a machine operator.

Ama sells fish and kenkey (akin to a sourdough dumpling) at Mbeam near Abura, which she has done for six years.  Ama uses her income to care for her children and pay other household expenses. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase fish and ingredients for her kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fish and ingredients for her kenkey.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 33-year-old married man. He has four children, ranging from 9 months to 10 years. He describes himself to be a social man. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cows. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a busy market, and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cows for resale. His business goal is to improve the business within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children up to university level and improve his family living standard.

loans.use: to buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 26 years old and married, with two children who are in school. 

He does welding to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

He previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business.  With the income he generated, he was able to support his family. 

He dreams of expanding his business and employing more people.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old and married, with two children who are in school. 

With her motorcycle, she supplies milk to different locations to earn a living. She has been operating this business for two years and has employed one person. She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy another motorcycle.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has become economically empowered by being trained in business management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase foods and beverages in bulk to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi has received education through primary school.  She is divorced and has four children. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses.

Esi sells gari (pickled ginger) at Mbeam near Abura.  Esi has been selling gari for one year.  Her loan will be used to purchase ingredients for her gari. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her gari.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells and extracts palm oil in Mbeam, which is near Abura. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Maame has been selling and extracting palm oil for 22 years. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase materials for palm oil extraction. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for palm oil extraction

loans.name: Yaaya

texts.en: Yaaya is widowed and has 4 children. She has received schooling through Junior Secondary School. Yaaya sells palm oil in Mbeam, which near Abura. She has been doing this for 4 years. Yaaya uses her income to care for her children and pay other household expenses. Yaaya will use the loan to purchase materials for her palm oil business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaaya plans to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her palm oil business

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is a 43-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. For 10 years now, she has been engaged in a business selling fish. Out of her income, she is able to help her fisherman husband and raise their six children (ages 2-13). 

Leonides works hard to earn a living selling fresh fish. The income supports her family's daily food consumption. She is asking for a loan to buy a new  fish net and more fresh fish to resell. She believes that if she will be supported through loans, she will be able to improve her business to generate more revenue. Leonides dreams of seeing her family experiencing fullness of life too.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net and more fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and sales and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of goods in bulk to sell from her general store

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Daniela is 56 years old and from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with children who are mostly adults. Daniela has been in the business of hog raising for two years now. She is asking for a loan to buy quality hog feed and new piglets to raise to increase her income. This is her family's livelihood and helps to support the needs of her family.  A loan will be helpful so she can stock enough supply of hog feed without compromising her hogs' growth. The income that she will generate from this business will be used to buy healthy meals for her family. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger income out of her hog-raising business.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase general goods to sell from her store.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods and food for her general store.

loans.name: Bi

texts.en:
Bi is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as foods and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos, to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his supermarket by buying various goods, such as water, juice, biscuits, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as foods and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
Thi would like to take a further loan to buy new hairdressing tools and cosmetic products to sell in her salon. Thi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools and cosmetic products to sell in her salon.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en:
Tham is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages and basic goods, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy foods, beverages, and basic goods in bulk to sell from her store.

loans.name: Ricardo Roberto

texts.es: Ricardo, es una persona de 61 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar una carrera profesional en Diseño y Administración a nivel ingeniería, no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo y vive en su propio domicilio que se halla situado en la localidad de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. El señor Cárdenas actualmente percibe una renta mensual de jubilado de una empresa y por lo cual en la actualidad está ampliando su vivienda y para tal efecto con suma urgencia se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de materiales de construcción y que a futuro el cliente tiene pensado montar otro tipo de negocio que le remunerara ingresos económicos adicionales que vayan a mejorar la calidad de su persona.
texts.en: Ricardo is 61 years old and single.  He studied Engineering Design Management.  He doesn’t have any dependents and lives in a home of his own, located in Tíraque, about 65 km from Cochabamba.  Mr. Cárdenas receives a monthly retirement sum from a company, with which he is expanding his home.  For this reason he is in need of capital to buy building materials.  In the future he plans to start another business that will provide income that will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is 23 years old and married. She has one child who is still young. She purchases clothes to sell in her market. She has been in this business for two years. She and her husband manage the business together.

Mwaka has requested a Kiva loan, via Yehu, in order to buy more clothes for resale. With any profits from the loans, she will be able to save for her future and to pay for her child's school fees when she is enrolled in school. 

The majority of the people like her because her prices are low compared to her colleagues. She is also a jovial person who likes caring for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep is requesting a new loan to buy lottery tickets to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a hardworking woman and the mother of four children whom she loves very much. She is working hard to make sure that they have everything that they need to get ahead in the world. She lives in a house in Tiribe, Kenya.

Nyamvula works at the market, buying and selling clothing. She is an enthusiastic businesswoman and works up to 10 hours a day. She sells to as many as 10 buyers a day and says that she is happy with her progress. She thinks the business is successful because she is friendly and approachable and because she offers a good range of merchandise.

Nyamvula is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the opportunity given, she will be able to purchase clothes for sale. In addition, she intends to stock utensils. 

The investment will allow her to provide a wider range of merchandise and, in turn, increase her income. She dreams of opening a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and utensils for sale.

loans.name: Nimia Eliceth

texts.es:
La señora Nimia de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales uno de ellos ya esta casado, dos trabajan y una estudian, Doña Nimia este es su cuarto prestamo ella ha mejorado su nivel de vida ya que de los tres hijos que dependendian de ella ya solo tiene a su hija menor de dependiente a quien paga el colegio, Doña Nimia tiene casa propia y un negocio de pulpería esta ubicado en su casa, pues ahí ella vende pollo, granos básicos, leches, frescos, etc. Ubicado en la parte sur de San Lorenzo, Valle.
Doña Nimia solicita el préstamo para comprar carnes, pollo, embutidos, leche, queso, jabón, detergente, cloro, condimentos, y otros productos de consumo.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo Doña Nimia mejorara su negocio y también sus ingresos.
Doña Nimia sus metas es crecer en su negocio y su deseo es sacar adelante a su hija que esta estudiando.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012.
texts.en:
Nimia is 44 years old and is a single mother with 4 children. One of her children is already married, two work and one is in school. She has her own house and grocery business which is located in her house. Here she sells chicken, staple grains, milk, refreshments, etc. She is located in the southern part of San Lorenzo Valley. 

Nimia is requesting a loan to buy meats, chicken, preserved meats, milk, cheese, soap, detergent, bleach, condiments and other consumer products. With the support of this loan, Nimia will improve her business and also her income. Her goal is to make her business grow and her wish is to move her daughter who is studying forward.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, preserved meats, milk, cheese, soap, detergent, bleach, condiments and other consumer products for her business.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita, es una persona de 45 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, pero vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria y cuenta con 4 dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica principal de la clienta es la comercialización de papa y otras hortalizas los fines de semana en una localidad de la ciudad de Santa Cruz durante casi toda la gestión anual; asimismo como segunda actividad económica la clienta y su familia se dedica a la producción agrícola, cultiva en especial la papa y haba en sus propios terrenos que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Cuartel Parcela - Iluri del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Siancas manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que tiene el deseo de seguir superándose y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de insumos agrícolas y capital de operaciones para comercio de tal  forma mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Benita is 45 years old.  She is single but in a live in relationship.  She completed elementary school and has four dependents; her children.  She sells potatoes and other vegetables from a location in Santa Cruz on the weekends.  As a second income she and her family farm and raise potatoes and beans on their own land, located in Cuartel Parcela a suburb of Tíraque, about 65 km from Cochabamba.  [Benita] is a hardworking and responsible person who wants to continue getting ahead.  For this reason she has seen the need to request additional capital to buy farming supplies and use as working capital for her business operations.  In this way she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Big Martet Costmetics Unit Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Big Market Cosmetics Sellers Unit” from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. 

They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Abu is the leader of this group. The 33-year-old is married to a businesswoman; they have three children. 

Abu, who sells ready-to-wear-clothes, has been a businessman for many years now.  With his share of this loan, he will buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy large quantities of meat for resale.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 35 years old and married, with two children aged 2 and 12 years. 

He sells clothes and shoes. He has five years of experience in this work, and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Jean Marie Vianney has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy clothes and shoes for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marlitt

texts.es:
La señorita Marlitt sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “MINIBANK” de la Asociación Arariwa.  

La señorita Marlitt tiene 23 años y es soltera. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco donde realiza diferentes de tipos de trabajos eventuales, ella sigue estudiando en una Universidad de la ciudad del Cusco. La señorita Marlitt es un joven responsable y trabajadora requiere el préstamo con el fin de ayudar a pagar su matrícula de la universitaria, ella tiene que pagar por sus estudios por su cuenta. 

La señorita Marlitt está muy agradecida por el préstamo, ya que significa que será capaz de pagar la escuela. La señorita Marlitt se ha comprometido a sus estudios y muy apasionados sobre el aprendizaje. Ella se compromete a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en:
Marlitt continues to be a part of the “MINIBANK” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa.

Marlitt is 23 years old and single.  She lives in Cusco, within the Cusco department, where she does different types of jobs.  She continues to study at the university in Cusco.  Marlitt is a responsible and hardworking young woman and needs a loan to help pay her university tuition.  She has to pay for her own studies.

Marlitt is very grateful for the loan because it will allow her to pay for her schooling.  She has committed herself to her studies and is very passionate about learning.  She promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Pay All Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Pay All” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Seray is the leader of this group. Seray is 29 years old and married with two children, one in primary school and one in secondary school. 

Seray sells "Bamako" cloths (prestigious cloths dyed in Mali) and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Seray will invest in her business by buying different kinds of Bamako cloths in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of Bamako cloths in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is 28 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with four children.
 
Danny works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for two years. He has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase fishing net.
 
Danny has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Danny hopes to save for the education of his children.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth is 43 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Jeaneth has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase feeds for her hog-fattening activity. 

Jeaneth has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Jeaneth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds.

loans.name: Angelica Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Angelica tiene 22 años y tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de dos años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Angelica va a usar este préstamo  para comprar cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Angelica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Angelica, 22, has a two year old son and sells cosmetics from a catalog. She promotes her beauty products going door to door, visiting public and private institutions and homes in different neighborhoods. This is her first loan with the institution. Angelica will use it to buy cosmetics that are on sale so that she can have them in stock. Her reason for requesting the loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy her clients. Angelica faces challenges in her work like tending to her clients efficiently. She will use the benefits to improve her family's quality of life, since this is her only economic activity with which she maintains her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics that are on sale.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is married and has two children. Cherry Mae is 24 years old and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Cherry Mae is operating a fishing business venture, selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp, to earn a living. She's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. In 2010, Cherry Mae joined GDMPC. In the future, Cherry Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is married with three children. Florida is 54 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Florida sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Florida has been a member of PMPC for almost eight years. In the future, Florida hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, es una persona de 39 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con 5 dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos; la actividad económica principal a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola; produce papa, maíz y arveja en sus propias parcelas que son producto de herencia por parte de sus padres y además que cuentan con riego por inundación las mismas se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Waca Huasi del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 70 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. Finalmente el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener ganas de poder incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de terreno y de tal forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia atreves de incrementar su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Mario is 39 and has a common-law wife. He studied through primary school. He owns his home and has 5 dependent children in his charge. He is a farmer, producing potatoes, corn and peas on his parcels that he inherited from his parents. The land is irrigated by floods. The farmland is in the community of Waca Huasi in the county of Tíraque, about 70 km from the city of Cochabamba. 

Mario and his wife want to increase their agricultural production and in order to do so they need investment capital to buy land. This way they will improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm land.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth, the mother of a child named Maria, works as a seasonal farmer. Elisabeth's job depends on the planting and harvesting seasons. Weather-related factors are an obstacle for Elisabeth. Because her income is erratic, Elisabeth is worried about Maria's education. Elisabeth also has to feed four children, which costs quite a lot. Elisabeth has applied for a loan from Kiva in order to help Maria become a computer expert. In the picture, Elisabeth, her daughter Maria and the youngest son.

Maria is the second child with four brothers who live in a hilly and barren area. She attends a vocational school. Maria expects that with the student loan program, she can continue her studies through to completion. Hopefully, her ideals can be achieved and she can become a computer expert.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Santa Laura Bicentenario Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Santa Laura Bicentenario” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; repostería, pastelería, almacén, venta de ropa, verdulería, lencería, tejidos, electricidad, comida rápida, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Recoleta, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Ángela, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste con una polera de color negra y encima usa un poleron de color rojo, de adorno lleva una cadenita, su color de cabello es oscuro y lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica a la compra y cambio de juegos de video de playstation, desde hace 2 meses. Se desempeña en sus labores los días sábados, domingos y festivos de 10ºº hasta las 18ºº horas, se ubica en un persa ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago donde ofrece los videos juegos a su clientela.
La mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y proveedores de video juegos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará nuevos videos juegos y joysticks para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Ángela es poder agrandar su local con más variedades de juego, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ángela vive junto a su esposo y 2 hijos de 11 y 16 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños son instalar otro local dentro del mismo persa pero de diferente rubro como la confección de ropa en general.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le  permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo el Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Santa Laura Bicentenario." It is formed by 19 entrepreneurs who work in different businesses, among which are a pastry shop, a cake shop, a store, selling clothes, a greengrocers, lingerie, knitting, electricity, fast food, and services, among others. All the members are from the Recoleta area, located in the city of Santiago.

Angela, a member of this communal bank, is standing in the first row in the photograph, in the third spot going from right to left. She is wearing a black T-shirt and over it a red sweatshirt. For jewelry, she is wearing a little chain. Her hair is dark and short. She has been buying and exchanging Playstation video games for two months. She performs her work on Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays from 10 am until 6 pm. She works in a market located in the city of Santiago where she offers video games to her customers. She buys her merchandise from distributors and suppliers of video games at low cost, so it is economically expedient. With the loan she will buy new video games and joysticks to stock her business. One of Angela's goals is to be able to enlarge her shop with more varieties of games to generate more income, so that with this she can have a better quality of life.

Angela lives with her husband and their two children, ages 11 and 16, who are in school. Her dreams are to set up another shop of a different type inside the same market, such as for clothing in general. She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. With respect to the communal bank group of which she is a part, she comments that there is very good communication within it. In addition, through the training she has learned new strategies for sales and accounting.

Recoleta is one of the 34 areas of Santiago (the capital of Chile), and it is located in the center north of the Santiago metropolitan region. It has commercial activity, especially in the commercial neighborhood of Patronato, which has welcomed principally the Arab business people (at first) and the Koreans (now).

loans.use: to buy new video games and joysticks to stock her business.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Juana;la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de salon de belleza ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia realiza teñidos,cortes de cabello ,ondulaciones entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando para su familia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de tintes y secadoras.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana continues running her beauty salon. She has been doing this for years and it's going well thanks to the determination that she puts into her work. She does cuts, colors and perms, among other things. She is responsible and determined and has a great desire to continue working for progress for her family.

She asks for a loan to buy dyes and dryers. She is grateful for the support that has been given to her and promises to be disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: to buy dyes and dryers.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 41 years old and is married with two children. She is from Capucao, Ozamis City. To make a living, Rosalina operates a charcoal-making business. She's been in this business for 16 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Rosalina joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, aged 26, is a married entrepreneur from Gata Daku, Clarin who has two children. She earns an income from her motorcycle transport business which she started almost two years ago and from which she earns 14,000 PHP a month. 

To improve her business, she is borrowing 50,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which she joined recently, to obtain motorcycle accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain motorcycle accessories and tires

loans.name: Margarita Cortona

texts.es: La señorita Margarita pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK” de la Asociación Arariwa, Margarita vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, tiene 67 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos de las cuales tres son independientes y uno depende de ella todavía, ella es docente y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, ella está pidiendo un préstamo para uso personal pues desea pagar la matrícula de la Universidad de su hijo. Su hijo tiene 22 años y asiste a la Universidad. Ella se ha comprometido a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en: Margarita belongs to the communal bank "MINIBANK" of the Arariwa Association. Margarita lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, is 67 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are independent, and one still depends on her. She is a teacher and works in one of the schools in the city of Cusco. She is asking for a loan for personal use because she wants to pay for her son's university tuition. Her son is 22 years old and attends the university. She has committed to making all of the necessary payments of the loans on time.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Komlanvi

texts.fr: Célibataire de 32ans, Mr Komlanvi est propriétaire de salle de jeux. Il a démarré en 2009 par projeter des films et du football à ses clients qui n’ont pas la possibilité de s’offrir un abonnement à la maison. Pour pouvoir garder ses nombreux, il sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter des décodeurs et des télévisions. Avec les profits, il veut multiplier ses salles de jeux dans plusieurs quartiers, ajouter une activité parallèle comme la vente de cassettes et CD et sa marier plus tard.
texts.en:
Mr. Komlanvi is 32 years old and single. He owns an entertainment room.

He launched his business in 2009 in order to show films and soccer matches to his customers who are unable to  afford a subscription at home. In order to be able to retain his many [customers], he is seeking his first loan from WAGES to buy decoders and TV sets. With his profits, he would like to open more entertainment halls in various districts  as well as add a parallel activity such as the selling videotapes and CDs, and later on be able to marry.

loans.use: to buy decoders and TV sets.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 23-year-old resident of Capucao, Ozamis City. She provides for her child's needs from the small amount of 3,000 PHP which she earns monthly from her own piggery business. Rosemarie started this business five years ago to add to the income earned by her husband. 

Since 2008, she has been a member of GDMPC. Rosemarie is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microfinance to buy feeding supplies for her piggery. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Alarbe

texts.en:
Alarbe is from Lapasan, Clarin. She is 27 years old and married. Alarbe owns a retail store selling home and used products. Alarbe has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2008, Alarbe joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap for her son's scrap-selling business.

loans.name: Theavy's Group

texts.en:
Aged 29 years and a widow, Theavy is a mother of four children. Among her four children, she needs to look after only two daughters as they are still in school. Every morning, she sells vegetables in the local market in her community in order to support her children as a single mother. She has been with this business for 10 years and is able to earn about 11,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

Theavy's group consists of two female members. She has never been with VisionFund before, nor has her fellow group member. Now, she and her group member are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more vegetables (cucumbers, eggplants, cabbages, carrots, etc.) for resale. Moreover, some portion of it will be used to buy piglets as additional income. She hopes to double her income so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables (cucumbers, eggplants, cabbages, carrots, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, aged 42, is from Capucao, Ozamis City. She is married and has two children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice field

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is from Canibungan Daku, Clarin. She is 55 years old, is married and has four children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Alma joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing motorcycle to provide better service. Alma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her existing motorcycle to provide better service

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married with two children. She is 35 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamis City. Rosemarie has owned and operated a plot of farmland for 10 years, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP from her business. 

In 2008, Rosemarie joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In the future, Rosemarie wants to make improvements to her house and to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy new furniture, bowls and chopsticks. Her previous loan has enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. Huong hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, bowls and chopsticks

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with two children. She is 40 years old and lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. Fe owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 7,000 PHP each month. 

Fe has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, just this year. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. In the future, Fe's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying larger quantities of food and ingredients at wholesale prices. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. Hong hopes that another loan will assist her to attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and ingredients at wholesale prices

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying new products, such as bowls, plates, chopsticks and food ingredients, to satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. Van hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bowls, plates, chopsticks and food ingredients

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
As a 33-year-old mother of five children originally from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Than and her husband need to work on 2 hectares of rice farmland for her family's survival. During his spare time, her husband also works for others for a fee at a cassava field to earn extra income. Having been with this business for 16 years, she is able to earn about 16,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

Than's group consists of two female members; she is a fourth-time borrower, and her co-member is a third-time borrower. She has managed her past loans with success and they have helped her to timely support her cash-crop. Now, both of them are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy six sacks of fertilizer and pay for harvesting of her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business better than before so as to attain a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of fertilizer and pay for harvesting of her farmland.

loans.name: Cay

texts.en: Cay is requesting a new loan to buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and food to satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. Cay hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and food

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is a 43-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Yen helps her family by running a business which sells bread with small pieces of pork and sausages. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing food and good quality ingredients at wholesale prices. Yen hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and good quality ingredients at wholesale prices

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 51 years old and is married with two daughters. She and her husband support their family by selling noodles in the local community. 

Thu would like to take out a loan to increase the working capital for her business so she can buy better quality food such as meat, noodles and other ingredients to sell at higher margins. Thu hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality food such as meat, noodles and other ingredients

loans.name: Knox

texts.en:
Knox is a 50-year-old clergy member. He is married and has two kids. In 2003, Knox established a social welfare group out of the need to offer financial literacy and solutions to his congregation, which is composed of rural disadvantaged families. Through this social welfare group, Knox would arrange for seminars and field days through which his congregation would be trained on how to save and on good farming practices. The same members would also pool their savings together and offer some short-term loans to some of their members to repay with a small amount of interest. 

In 2005, Knox registered his group as a microfinance and consulting institution named Rural Economic Empowerment Programme (REEP). He hoped to mobilise savings from the church members and advance loans to the less fortunate in the church by facilitating them to pay school fees, buy farm inputs, buy water harvesting tanks and improve their general living standards. REEP grew within a few years and Knox recruited members from other denominations and also expanded to other towns because of the good advocacy the institution was getting through its members. Today, REEP has enrolled over 400 groups and has a network presence in central, eastern, and coastal Kenya. 

In response to the high cost of kerosene for lighting the members' households, REEP introduced solar lanterns from BrazAfric to its members by financing the members to buy these solar lamps. The demand for the solar lamps soon became too high, so REEP, due to limited cash flow, could not buy an adequate supply of solar lamps to meet the high demand. Knox has been enjoying some credit terms to pay for the lamps in 30 days. He is now seeking to purchase solar lamps worth $2,000 for his members through Kiva financing. 

On the uploaded photo is Knox with Sera- a member of one of his group called St Anne's Self help group in Voi, who purchased a solar lantern on loan from REEP. She has since finished repaying for the solar lamp and no longer has to spend so much money on buying Kerosene but rather she is happy that she can save now some extra money for food and school fees.

loans.use: to pay for solar lanterns

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more clothes from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. 

Hiep hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is requesting a new loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, shampoo, dyes and nail polish. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Phung hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, shampoo, dyes and nail polish

loans.name: Quan

texts.en:
Quan is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of clothes to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. 

Quan hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 29 years old, married with two children and lives in the Philippines. 
Julieta makes and sells snacks in her village such as hot cake and rice cake. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour, cheese and rice for making snacks.
Julieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been effectively doing business in the clothing trade for the last four years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers variety of clothes in different colors for her customers and makes enough to lead a decent life.
She is a loving mother of three daughters and two sons. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, keeping them healthy, and supporting their education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 35,000/- to buy more clothes in various designs and different colors. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Sreynin

texts.en:
Sreynin, aged 26, is married and is the mother of one child. With her three-member family, she lives in a rural area located in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province, Cambodia. In order to generate daily income for their basic household necessities especially for their child, both Sreynin and her husband have been working at the garment factory for one year. 

Sreynin has never been with Kiva partner, VisionFund, before. As a first-time borrower, she is seeking a loan to buy house construction materials including cement, steel, sand, roof, etc. A portion of the loan will be used to pay for the labor cost for house construction. She hopes to own a new solid house for her family instead of using the money to fix an old house. Then Sreynin can pay more attention to generating more income in order to support her child.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna is married and the mother of one child under school age. She is a resident of the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province (Cambodia). It is the area where rice farming is a common business. Vanna manages one hectare of farmland with assistance from her husband, growing paddy rice as their primary source of income.To increase the family's income, she also raises pigs at home while her husband sells his own produced rice wine. The main challenge for her family is the drought that made crop yields decline. Vanna's group is composed of three female members taking out a new loan and she is the group leader. She and one of the members are second loan cycle clients while the remaining member is a first loan cycle client. The past loans which she has repaid have helped her to manage her business. She will use her loan portion to buy three sacks of fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes that her business will grow as well as she expects so as to earn more income to buy a mini-tractor to support her rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Sek's Group

texts.en: Sek is 43 years old and originally from the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province. She has nine children. Seven of her children are still living with her and three of them are paid workers. The other children are still in school, helping the family's business, or under school age. To meet the daily basic needs for her big household, she has been working as a rice farmer for three years as the main source of income. Her husband works for others for a fee and also sells his handmade sugar palm. From the current business, she is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. Sek has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely repaid her loans. The past two loans have made a better living for her family. She has formed a group of three female members to seek a new loan. She and one of her group members are seeking for 500,000 KHR each while the remaining member is applying for 700,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for harvesting costs. She hopes that this loan will assist her during this harvesting season so as to receive a larger yield and make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay harvesting fees.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en: Cipriano is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. Cipriano  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages.He had this business for eight years.He requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cipriano has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future,Cipriano hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es: Tiburcio, es una persona de 58 años de edad, vive en su casa propia, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, y cuenta con una sola dependiente económica a cargo la cual es su hija. La actividad económica del cliente y su esposa es netamente la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva y comercializa son la papa, haba, arveja, cebada y maíz; la siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en sus propias parcelas que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Payco Mayu Bajo del municipio de Tíraque que esta distante aproximadamente a unos 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. El señor Marín y su esposa manifiestan ser personas trabajadores y responsables que quieren superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa y de tal forma obtener mayor productividad y a través de ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Tiburcio is a man of 58. He is married, and lives in his own house. He went to school as far as primary, and has one dependent: his daughter.

The livelihood of the client and his wife is clearly farming and the main products he grows and sells are potatoes, lima beans, peas, barley and corn. He plants these crops on his own parcels of land which are located in the community of Payco Mayu Bajo in the municipality of Tíraque, which is approximately 65 km from the city of Cochabamba. 

Tiburcio and his wife say they are hard-working and responsible people who wish to improve themselves and increase their agricultural production. To that end, they see the need to apply for investment capital, in order to purchase chicken manure and potato seed. In this way they can get greater productivity and thereby improve their family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy chicken manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rosalina became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stocs of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn, 39, is a widowed mother of three dependent daughters who are still in school. As a single mother, to bear her family's hardship, she has been growing paddy rice as the main source of income, supplementing her income by selling chickens and purchasing recycling waste. She has been operating these businesses for 17 years and they earn her about 19,000 KHR. 

Korn has borrowed from VisionFund four times. After these successful loans which have helped her to maintain her household and keep her children in school, she is now seeking a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR. Korn will use this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice field and will use a portion of it to buy more chickens to sell. She hopes to earn more income, so she can support her children's education to university level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice field, and to buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Bou's Group

texts.en:
Bou, aged 53, lives in a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is the mother of three children and has to provide for the two who are still in school. Bou has been a farmer on one hectare of farmland for 30 years where she grows paddy rice and can earn approximately 4.5 US dollars per day. Her husband also helps to earn more income for the family through working as a chief for wedding and religious ceremonies.

Bou's group consists of three female members: she and one of her co-members are third-time borrowers while the remaining group member is a second-time borrower. From the previous loans which she has repaid, Bou has been able to grow her cash crop in a timely fashion with a good yield.

Now, she feels confident in improving her family's standard of living to a good level especially for her children. Therefore, Bou is leading this group to seek a new loan.
