texts.es: Enrique vive en el sector del Fortín norte de Guayaquil donde tiene su taller de radiadores. Empezó aprendiendo el negocio trabajando como ayudante de su hermano quien tenía un local en el centro de la ciudad, le va muy bien sobre todo por la ubicación. Después de un tiempo decidió hacer un préstamo para emprender su propio negocio decisión de la cual no se arrepiente ya que tiene varios años y es muy conocido. Actualmente continúa trabajando con su hermano pero de una manea diferente ya que lo hace como socio. El atiende desde muy temprano ya que en eso consiste su éxito. Este préstamo que está solicitando es para la comprar de materiales para las reparaciones como radio ventilador, radiadores, refrigerantes etc., con el tiempo desea incrementar su negocio porque su sueño es poder comprar una casa ya que la actual es alquilada y desea darle una estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en: Enrique lives in the Fortín sector, north of Guayaquil, where he has a radiator shop.  He started learning about this business while working as a helper for his brother, who had a shop in the city center.  Things are going well for him because of the location.  After some time he decided to ask for a loan so that he could start his own business, a decision that he has no regrets over, as he has been working for several years and is very well known.  Currently he continues to work with his brother, but in a different capacity because he works as a partner.  He begins working very early and he is successful because of that.  He will use the money from this loan to buy repair supplies such as radiator fans, radiators, refrigerants, etc.  He wants to grow his business over time because his dream is to buy a house.  He rents his current home and he wants to provide stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Allahrakhi

texts.en:
Ms Allahrakhi  is a married woman and wants to start her own business.  She is a hard working lady and has extraordinary skills but due to shortage of money she is not able to begin her own business of hand embroidery.  She requested for a loan of RS. 30,000 to buy raw material, including cloth, threads, frames, needles, beats, pearls etc.  In this way she can initiate her business well.
                
She is responsible for providing her family with a good environment and to pay for their everyday expenditure.  She hopes to have a good experience with the new loan to overcome her costs and run her business successfully and hence provide better support to her family.

loans.use: To buy raw material including cloth, threads, frames, needles, beats, pearls, etc.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en:
Him, 52, is a citizen from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province (Cambodia).  She has two children living with her.  She provides the financial support for the family’s daily basic need from the three hectares of farmland via rice cultivation.  She is able to earn about 53,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for 20 years. 

Him forms a group of three members to seek a new loan and she is the group leader.  This is the eighth loan cycle for her, the sixth loan cycle for one of her fellow group member, and the first loan cycle for the remaining member.  She has used her loan with success to better support her business.  For her loan portion, she will use it to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to pay for the plowing fee for her farmland.  She hopes to receive double yields in order to obtain a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to pay for plowing fee for her farmland

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen is a 35-year-old mother of three children, some of whom are still in school. Her entire family is living in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two hectares of rice farm on which she is able to produce a rice crop twice per year. She and her husband have been in this business for seven years. 

This will be her fourth loan; the previous loans, which she has paid back, enabled her to sustain her business and improve her family's livelihood. Now, she is taking out a new loan with Kiva partner VisionFund for $500. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to grow her cash-crop in a timely manner so as to reach a great standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Ulziinyam

texts.en:
Mrs. Ulziinyam is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (tent) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband, Battsagaan, is 44 years old. He runs a taxi service. Her son, Batbaatar, is eight years old. He is a second grade school student. 

She started selling organic dairy products at a rental counter in 2005. In the beginning, her turnover capital was 50,000 Tugriks (MNT). Currently, her turnover capital increased and reached 3,000,000 MNT. She has improved her family life with the profits she earned. She is a hardworking and intelligent person. She needs 3,000,000 MNT to buy more organic dairy products from herders for her business.

loans.use: To buy more organic dairy products from herders for her business

loans.name: Rosiris Margoth

texts.es: Rosiris de 42 años de edad con su anterior credikiva compró materiales  con los cuales elaboró artesanías, así mismo invirtió en 2 porcinos en pie y los vendió para apoyar los estudios de sus hijos, que cursan en una  Universidad   de Barranquilla, ciudad a 2 horas de Cartagena. Hoy Rosiris se prepara para un nuevo credikiva, con el cual continuar  aumentando su capital de trabajo, porque responderá a encargos de hamacas, por eso comprará hilo fino en mayor volumen; con esta inversión presume tener mucho éxito, pues es la  que deja un mayor margen de utilidad y tener inventarios de estos productos le aumenta la probabilidad de su venta y capitalizar cada vez mas su negocio; con su anterior utilidad  invirtió   en la adquisición de la libreta militar de su hijo, esta vez planea reinvertir en su negocio. Rosiris está muy agradecida con los credikiva y dice que   es una posibilidad de salir adelante con su familia y estamos seguros de que lo hará.
texts.en:
Rosiris, 42, had a previous loan from Kiva with which she bought materials to make her handicrafts and also invested in two live pigs, which she sold to support her son’s studies at the University of Barranquilla, a city two hours away from Cartagena. 

Today, Rosiris is preparing for a new Kiva loan with which she will continue increasing her working capital because she will fill orders for hammocks. Thus she will purchase fine thread in greater volume. With this investment she thinks she will be very successful since it leaves her with a greater profit margin and with an inventory of these products, which will increase the probability of their sale and of her ability to capitalize her business even more. 

With her former profits, she invested in the acquisition of her son’s military I.D.. This time she plans to re-invest in her business. She is very grateful for the Kiva loans and says that they make it possible for her to get ahead with her family and we are sure she will.

loans.use: to purchase fine thread in greater volume.

loans.name: Diala

texts.en:
Diala is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She works hard to help her husband in providing for their family.

Diala is a hard worker. She is well-known in her region for selling beautiful and special designed bags and accessories from her house. 

Diala is working hard on improving her children's living conditions, providing them with the best education, and helping her husband in covering their expenses.

Diala applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for the new collection she ordered and its shipment fees.

She is so excited for this loan, because she believes that the new items will make her customers happy.

Diala is working hard to open her own retail shop in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her new collection and its shipment fees

loans.name: David Jesus

texts.es:
David es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, a pesar de ser tan joven él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, con un gran deseo por salir adelante; con mucho empeño culmino sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos aun no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones come una deliciosa Pizza, la cual es su comida favorita.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, David puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de animación de eventos, él brinda sus servicios como Disjokey, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 4 clientes semanales y cree que le va bien por sus buenas combinaciones musicales y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
David se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un tornamesas de vinil, un amplificador, audífonos, entre otros; de esta manera David contará con las herramientas necesarias para poder realizar su labor, así el espera poder conseguir más contratos para poder seguir trabajando e incrementando sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco ahorrará para poder iniciar sus estudios profesionales y poder así convertirse en un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
David is 20 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica. Despite being so young, he is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, with a great desire to move forward. He finished secondary school with a lot of determination. Sadly, because he has to work to pay his expenses, he has still not been able to study for a professional degree, but he dreams of being able to do it. In his free moments, he likes to relax by listening to a little music and sometimes he eats a delicious pizza, which is his favorite food.

David started his small business of event entertainment with a lot of determination and enthusiasm. He provides services as a disk jockey. He spends about eight hours a day on his business and he can attend to an average of four clients per week. He believes the business is going well for him because of his good music mixes and the friendly treatment he gives to his clients.

David is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they've given him, he will be able to buy a record turntable, an amplifier, and headphones, among other things. This way David will have the necessary tools to do his work. He hopes to be able to get more contracts to keep working and increase his income, which little by little he will save to be able to start his professional studies and become a upstanding man.

loans.use: to buy a record turntable, an amplifier, headphones, etc.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Mwanakombo.  She is married and has four children who are in school.  In 2008, Mwanakombo established a food vending business, selling food from her home.  She mostly sells dumplings to the neighborhood.  She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband with running their home. 

She would like a loan of 10,000 KES.  Mwanakombo is almost through with her first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, and baking powder, to meet the needs of her clients during this month of Ramadan.  Mwanakombo plans to open a food stall in future.  She tells us that her major drawback is high market competition now that everyone wants to take advantage of this festive month of Ramadan.

loans.use: to buy cooking items for her food vending business.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is married and has a child.  Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all things. They must to comfort their child with all modern conveniences. The fast development of the modern world makes her child more progressive. Gulchehra tries to provide him with a better quality of life; that’s why she began her own business 3 years ago. She sews traditional women's dresses. Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has improved. She wants to develop her business further, but she needs to buy fabrics. She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy fabrics. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Roun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Mongkoul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia, Roun is 32 years old. He is a married father of two daughters who all depend on him. He is a fisherman and sometimes works for others for a fee to earn extra income. He has been in this business for almost 10 years. The current business earns him about 20,000KHR per day, and he manages to save about 10,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Roun has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and has successfully paid back the past loan, while the other group member is in the first cycle with VisionFund. The first loan has helped him relieve his family’s burden and improve their  livelihood. Now he and his group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000KHR each. As the group leader, he is going to use his portion to buy a boat for fishing. He hopes this loan will enable him to catch more fish so as to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To buy a boat for fishing

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Binish

texts.en: Mrs. Binish lives in a small village. She is in her second loan cycle. She runs a small cattle-selling business. She has 4 goats and 2 kids (baby goats). She is a newly married woman. They were hardly meeting their daily expenses from the earnings of her husband. She was very worried, because she wanted to save some money for her future since her family expenses were gradually increasing at that time. She started this business with the support of her husband and a small start-up capital, and now she is requesting Rs 20,000 to purchase of some kids (baby goats). She is very hopeful that if she puts continual effort into her business, then one day she will be able to help her husband out a lot. This gives her great courage.

loans.use: To buy more kids (baby goats)

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is a 48-year-old mother originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Cambodia.  She has four children who are currently employed.  

She is a farmer who generates income by rice farming and cassava planting.  She has been in this business for 20 years and earns about 13,000 KHR per day.  Her main challenge is the drought, which reduces her crop yields.  

Sopheap's group consists of two members.  She is a five-time borrower and her co-member is a seven-time borrower.  She has used her past loans successfully to upgrade her lifestyle.  Sopheap, the group leader, is going to use part of her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and part of it to buy pigs for raising to earn additional income.  She hopes to grow her crop in a timely manner, so as to make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Anatariya

texts.en:
Anatariya is 32 years old.  She is married, but does not yet have a child.  She will use this loan to support labor costs.  She plans to use the profits from her rice production to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Phy, 42 years old and a resident from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Provice, is a mother of two children, one son and one daughter, who are still dependent on her. They are students in a local public school. To support her children, she runs a small grocery stall in the village, earning about 11,000 KHR. Phy has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and has successfully paid back the loans, which have made a better living for her family. 

Now, she leads a group of three female members to seek a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy grocery items (canned foods, instant noodles, food ingredients, etc.) and vegetables to sell. She expects to earn more income from her current business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy construction supplies for a private contracting business

loans.name: Ismayilkhan

texts.ru: Ismayilkhan jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On ochen lubit svoyu semyu. Yemu 41 god. On jivet v Fizuli regione vemeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Ismayilkhan yavlayyetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. On nujdayestay v 1500 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyego taxi. Ismayilkhan uje 9 let kak vodit taxi. On starayetsya vse vremya uludshit svoy mesachniye doxodi dlya soderjaniya svoyey semyi.
texts.en: Ismayilkhan is married and has three children.  He loves his family very much.  He is 41 years old.  He lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and children.  Ismayilkhan is an IDP from the city of Fuzuli.  He needs 1500 AZN to purchase spare parts to repair his taxi.  Ismayilkhan has been driving a taxi for nine years.  He tries all the time to improve his monthly income in order to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila is 30 and married, with two children, all of whom are dependent on him and still in school. His family lives in the rural village of Ratanak Mondul, Battambang province. Sila and his wife make a living through farming rice on four hectares of farmland and supplement their income by planting red corn. Having been in this business for six years, they can earn about KHR10,000 per day and manage to save about KHR3,000 each day after daily expenses. Lack of capital to support their business is still the main challenge for them.

Sila has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles and has completely paid back the past loans, which helped him to relieve the family’s burden. Now he is applying for another loan from VisionFund. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income so as to make a good living for his family and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm and to hire labor

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is married to a farmer, and they have one child, aged two years. He has requested a loan for use in the support of labor costs; he says that he is very experienced in this domain because he has spent four years in rice production. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

Agriculture accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of its export revenue, and employs about 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as high-risk because profitability is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. Thus, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru: Насибахон проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Насибахон занимается торговлей. У нее имеется торговая точка на центральном рынке района. Насибахон в основном занимает торговлей детской одежды. Этим видом бизнеса она занимается несколько лет. Насибахон просит кредит для приобретения праздничных детских костюмчиков и наборов для навороженных. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара, также она намерена отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Nasibakhon lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 34 years old, married and has five children.  Nasibakhon is involved in sales.  She has a retail outlet at the district's central market.  Nasibakhon primarily sells children's clothing.  She has been in this business for several years.  Nasibakhon is requesting this loan to purchase children's holiday suits and sets for newborns.  She wants to expand her merchandise selection and also repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase children's holiday suits and sets for newborns

loans.name: Dora Alba

texts.es: Dora de 39 años, ofrece sus servicios como manicurista y pedicurista desde hace 5 años; estos han resultado la fuente primaria con que solventa  los gastos de su hogar conformado por su esposo y dos hijos en las edades de 15 y 16 años. Ella ha logrado su sostenibilidad en el mercado, porque está pendiente de su actualización  a través de procesos formativo, en los que logra adquirir herramientas técnicas, para competir en el mercado aplicando  las mejores técnicas a su clientela. Sus principales clientes son  amas de casa y empleados de empresas, a quienes   atiende a domicilio o en su propia casa. En su tarea diaria de negocio, de lunes a domingo y cuando lo necesite el cliente, la inspira su afán de lograr que sus hijos en el futuro, se conviertan en unos profesionales exitosos. Su plan de crecimiento inicia con la compra de materiales e insumos en un mayor volumen, con el fin de lograr ganar descuentos que se traduzcan en utilidades y en un buen servicio a su clientela y que  su negocio físicamente funcione en un ambiente confortable. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales e insumos para aplicarlo a su diario trabajo, también invertirá en adecuaciones a su negocio y en la compra de herramientas de trabajo, para mejorar la calidad de su servicio y en esto radica el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Dora, 39, has been providing manicure and pedicure services for five years.  This has become her main source of income to cover expenses for her home which consists of her husband and two children who are 15 and 16 years old.  

She has managed to keep her market share because she’s kept up-to-date through courses where she acquires technical skills to compete in the market by applying better techniques on her customers.  Her main customers are housewives and employees in firms who she takes care of either at their homes or in her own home.  

She works every day from Monday through Sunday or whenever the customer needs her and is inspired by her drive to see her children become successful professionals in the future.  Her growth plan starts with the purchase of supplies in larger amounts in order to qualify for volume purchase discounts which translate into higher profits and good customer service so that her business will function in a comfortable environment.

This is precisely why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy supplies for her daily work.  
She will also invest in making improvements to her business with the purchase of work tools to improve the quality of her service; this is what her loan’s success resides in.

loans.use: to buy manicure and pedicure supplies.

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es: Cleotilde invirtió su credikiva en dos partes, por un lado compró materias primas con los cuales fabricó bolos y por otro lado invirtió en el cultivo del campo; Su meta es continuar tecnificando su infraestructura y tener   maquinaria industrial y construir un deposito donde provisionarse de agua. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es de agradecimiento y que pide que en la medida en que pasen los años, sean más alto los montos de los créditos,  para aumentar el tamaño de los negocios financiados, siempre y cuando sean bien pagados. En la actualidad Cleotilde está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual planea invertir en materias primas e insumos para fabricar nuevas mochilas que están encargadas y que muy seguramente serán de muy buen diseño para impactar a su clientela
texts.en:
Cleotilde invested her Kiva loan in two parts.  On the one hand she bought raw materials she used to make tote bags and on the other hand invested in her crops.  Her goal is to continue adding more technology to her infrastructure and to have industrial machinery and to install a tank to store and supply her with water.

Her message to Kiva lenders is one of gratitude and she asks that as the years go by that the loan amounts be increased in order to increase the size of financed businesses when they are repaid well.  Currently, Cleotilde is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies to manufacture new backpacks she has on order and that undoubtedly will be very well designed to impact her clientele.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
La socia Teresa,la socia continua trabajando como docente del nivel primario,la socia lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo su profesion la cual ella se siente feliz ya que trabaja en algo que le gusta,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a realizar las manualidades como en ceramica y tela,la socia vende estas manualidades a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades y familiares,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para sus manualidades como telas e hilos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Teresa continues working as an elementary school teacher.  She’s been working in her profession for some time and she feels happy to be working doing what she likes.  At the same time, she continues making clay and fabric crafts to sell to her customers, like acquaintances and family members, who request them.  She is a very responsible, dedicated person and this is the way she supports her family.  She’s requesting the loan to buy crafts-making supplies like fabric and thread.  She is grateful for the support she’ll get and promises to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Teofilo; el socio continua dedicandose a su negocio de administrar su jardin ,el socio administra conjuntamente con su esposa,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando cada dia,siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para el jardin como papeles.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Teófilo continues running his Kindergarten with his wife.  He’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort he puts into the business.  He’s a responsible, dedicated person who very much wants to continue to work every day since this is how he supports his family.  He’s asking for the loan to buy supplies like paper for the Kindergarten.   He is grateful for the support he’ll get and commits to make his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his Kindergarten.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Libia, la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de autorpartes de carro,la socia cuenta con un local donde vende su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante y apoya a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su negocio.

 La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Libia continues with her auto spare parts business.  She has a locale where she sells her merchandise to customers who request it.  She’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person and this is the way she gets ahead and supports her family.  She requests the loan to buy tires for her business.  She is grateful for the support she will get and commits to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de especias, como achote, pimienta, mostaza, comino, entre otros, toda su mercadería es de primera calidad y la vende a precios accesibles, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside, tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que le permite estar adelante de la competencia, además de su excelente servicio; María es una mujer que ama su labor, trabaja desde muy temprano para al final del día poder compartir con lo mas importante para ella su familia, es emprendedora, enérgica y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere alcanzar el éxito y no descansara hasta lograrlo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda de su producto y necesita aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar achote, comino, mostaza, pimienta, etc. María Isabel tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
María Isabel, 58, lives with her life companion and their two children in a house of their own.  She sells spices like annatto, pepper, mustard and cumin, among others.  All of her merchandise is top quality and she sells it at affordable prices.  She’s very well-known in the zone where she lives.  She has much sales experience and she’s acquired a large clientele that allows her to stay ahead of the competition; in addition her customer service is excellent.

María is a woman who loves her work.  She starts work very early so that at the end of the day she can spend time with her family who are the most important for her.  She’s enterprising and energetic and very much wants to get ahead.  She wants to attain success and will not rest until she does so.

Demand for her products has increased in the last few weeks and she needs to increase her investment so she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy annatto, cumin, mustard, pepper, etc.  María Isabel’s acquaintances give her good payment references.  She is sure she will be able to repay the loan in the established time frame and at the same time has faith that she will be able to provide her home with economic security.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Minerva Rosa

texts.es: Minerva de 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 30; ella es la propietaria de un negocio de confecciones, que funciona en su propia vivienda  desde hace 18 años, su negocio    nació cuando trabajó como empleada doméstica y aprendió  durante dos de la dueña de esa casa. Cuando tuvo oportunidad, Minerva  se capacitó en el Servicio nacional de Aprendizaje SENA y una vez terminó sus estudios,  decidió organizar un taller poco a poco, que le permitiera atender a sus hijos y trabajar desde su propio hogar. En la actualidad ofrece el servicio de confecciones a colegios, estudiantes, trabajadores independientes y educadores y se enfoca en la línea de ropa industrial. Inerva en la actualidad  elabora vestidos estudiantiles, uniformes deportivos y ropa femenina principalmente. Sus ventas las realiza principalmente de contado y sus compras también en almacenes especializados en insumos de confecciones en la ciudad de Cartagena y algunas veces viaja a la ciudad de Barranquilla a conseguir mas opciones de accesorios variados.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas e hilos y realizará adecuaciones locativas a su taller, pues quiere aumentar su volumen de sus ventas, porque tiene un potencial de crecimiento en el mercado, que no ha explorado y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Minerva, 48, is the mother of three children whose ages range from 12 to 30.  She’s owned a sewing business that operates at home for the last 18 years.  Her business was born when she used to work as a domestic employee and learned from her employer during two years.  When she got the opportunity, Minerva took courses at SENA [National Occupational Learning Center] and when she finished her course work decided to gradually set up a workshop that would allow her to work from home while caring for her children.

She currently sews for schools, students, independent workers and teachers; her focus is industrial clothing.  Minerva is currently manufacturing student outfits, sports uniforms and women’s clothes primarily.  Her sales are primarily cash and her purchases in specialized sewing supply warehouses in the city of Cartagena are too.  Sometimes she travels to the city of Barranquilla to have more varied options in accessories.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy fabric and thread and will also do some physical upgrades to her shop because she wants to increase sales since she has growth potential in the marketplace that she’s not yet explored which is precisely what will make the investment of her loan successful.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and to do physical upgrades to her shop.

loans.name: Nabela

texts.en:
Nabela is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to three sons. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Nabela and her husband have been distributing and selling gas canisters to customers, which has been a profitable project, but needs more support to cover its costs. Nabela is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing additional numbers of gas canisters to cover the great demand from customers. This will increase sales and improve the family's income positively.

Nabela and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase gas canisters to resell

loans.name: Sojod

texts.en:
Sojod is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Issam appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Sojod is a 21-year-old young woman. She is married and the mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband Issam is a painter who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Sojod wants to live with her family in suitable home conditions, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of making necessary repairs to her house in order to improve her family's living conditions in the house, such as painting and installing new electric extensions. Taking this loan will offer to Sojod and her family suitable home conditions, so the family can enjoy living in the house.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia está muy agradecida con Kiva porque la está apoyando y su capital de trabajo está creciendo; el primer finaciaminto lo invirtió en articulos d ela canasta familiar que pudo comprar en mayor cantidd y de contado y esto la llevó a tener su estanteria siempre con un buen surtido de ramchos víveres y licores. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva,con el cual hará adecuaciones al local para aumentar el espacio de surtido y tambien comprará víveres, ranchos, embutidos, refrescos y bebidas. Antonia tiene nuevas expectativas con su finacimeinto futuro porque notamos que está creciendo cada vez mas. Su mensaje alos finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Gracias.... les agradezco por haberme apoyado"
texts.en: Antonia’s very grateful to Kiva because it’s supporting her and her working capital is growing.  She used her first loan to buy basic staple items in large amounts and for cash which led to her having her shelves always well stocked with snacks, foodstuffs and liquor.  Today, she’s applying for a new Kiva loan she’ll use to make physical upgrades to the shop in order to expand the space for her inventory; she will also buy snacks, foodstuffs, canned goods, soft-drinks and beverages.  Antonia has new expectations with her future loan because she’s growing all the time.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you…I’m grateful for your having supported me.”

loans.use: to stock her store and make physical upgrades to it.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana Elizabeth de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijas; ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras tomates, cebollas, plátanos, pepinos, entre otros, desde hace mas de diez años, el tiempo le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le ayudo ha convertirse en una excelente vendedora, comercia en el mercado de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad a precios accesibles; Ana es una mujer enérgica, responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran paso para alcanzar el éxito, en los últimos meses aumento de la demanda de su producto lo cual le permitió mantenerse al frente la competencia, quiere acrecentar el negocio pero no posee de suficiente capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tomates, chile, cebolla, aguacate, plátanos, etc. Ana Elizabeth tiene buen record de crédito, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabeth, 38, lives with her life companion and their daughters.  She has sold fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, bananas and cucumbers, among others for more than ten years.  Time has given her much experience that has helped her become an excellent merchant.  She sells in her local market and has many customers because people prefer her because she always has what they need: quality products at affordable prices.

Ana is an energetic, responsible woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will open paths to success.  

Demand for her products has increased the last few months which allowed her to stay ahead of the competition.  She wants to expand the business but lacks capital to back her up which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy tomatoes, chilies, onions, avocadoes, bananas, etc.  Ana Elizabeth has good credit history and is sure that she will be able to repay the loan in the established time frame while at the same time is confident that she will be able to give her family better quality of life.
.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Ahed

texts.en:
Ahed is a 41-year-old man who is married and a father to one son. For the past two years, Ahed has been operating a barber shop. This has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover his family's cost of living.

Ahed is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new barber kit including different types of hairbrushes, hair and face creams, and hair dryers. This will improve Ahed's work quality and increase the demand from his customers. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions. Ahed is photographed in the barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new barber kit

loans.name: Yolanda Del Socorro

texts.es: Con su anterior creikiva, Yolanda estuvo muy contenta porque compró productos vitaminicos naturales en mayor volumen, materias primas e insumos con los que elaboró muñecas y todo esto lo vendió entre sus clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que comprará articulos de perfumeria, accesorios de oro y de plata que tiene encargados e insumos para continuar haciendo productos artesanales. Yolanda cada vez que invierte en su negocio obtiene msyores ganancias y y por eso está diversificando su oferta constantemente porque responde a todo cuanto le pide su clientela y así mantiene su fidelidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda was very happy with her previous loan because she bought natural vitamin products in bulk, raw materials, and supplies with which she made dolls.  She sold all of this to her customers.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy perfume items and gold and silver accessories that she has orders for.  She will also buy supplies to continue making handicraft products.

Every time that Yolanda invests in her business she gets more income.  That is why she is constantly diversifying what she sells.  She responds to everything that her customers request.  This way she keeps their loyalty.

loans.use: to buy perfume items, gold and silver accessories, and supplies to continue making handicraft products.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal, who appears in the picture, is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son. Her husband is a worker and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs of living.

For the past two years, Manal has had her own project raising and selling rabbits to customers, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support from time to time to cover its costs.

Manal is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more of rabbits to raise and resell to customers. This will increase sales and increase Manal's income, which will enable her to offer to her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more rabbits to raise and resell

loans.name: Obada

texts.en:
Obada, who appears in the picture, is a 22-year-old single young man. For the past three years, Obada has been operating a motorcycle repair workshop, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him. But it is not enough to cover his cost of living.

Obada is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary spare parts for repairing motorcycles. This will improve Obada's work quality and increase the demand from his customers to repair their motorcycles. This will increase his income and offer  better living conditions for him.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for repairing motorcycles

loans.name: Qaher

texts.en: Qaher is a 37-year-old man. He is married and a father to one son and one daughter. For the past three years, Qaher has had a sewing workshop for sewing clothes for customers, which has been a profitable business. Qaher is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more threads and textiles, which will enable him to continue his work and to provide better quality to his loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Qaher's income. Qaher is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase threads and textiles

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein, who appers in the picture, is a 30-year-old single man. He operates a restaurant selling falafel and shawarma sandwiches, which are traditional Palestinian foods. This business has been profitable, but Hussein needs more support to work in better conditions. Hussein is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new machine for making and frying falafel at his restaurant. This will allow him to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for making and frying falafel

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en:
Yaseen, who appears in the picture, is a 25-year-old single young man. He is a worker and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his needs.

Yaseen has a center for selling agricultural seedlings, which has been a profitable project and has a good reputation among customers, but also which needs more support to cover the costs.

Yaseen is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing bulk olive seedlings for sale and preparing for the coming agricultural season. This will attract more customers to purchase their seedlings from Yaseen's center, which will increase his income and ensure a better future for him.

loans.use: To purchase olive seedlings to resell to customers

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the grocery store.

Ayat is a 32-year-old young woman who is married and a mother of three sons and four daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Ayat has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs. Ayat is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing the needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and milk, and to make improvements to the store such as installing additional shelves. This will increase sales and improve the family's income to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase basic groceries that customers often request

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es: María Cecilia vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta cilantro, rábano, chipilín, entre otros, comercia en el mercado de la localidad todas las mañanas y es muy conocida, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, además por las tardes le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura para así complementar los gastos del hogar; María es una mujer entregada a su labor, responsable y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran puertas al éxito y no esta dispuesta a rendirse pues sabe que así podrá ganar un futuro mas prospero, en las últimos meses tuvo perdidas en las ventas y quiere recuperarse pero necesita de capital para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cilantro, rábano, chipilín, etc. María Cecilia tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejore calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Cecilia lives with her life's companion and their children. She sells cilantro, radishes, chipilin and more. She sells in the local market mornings and is very well known. She has a lot of customers because people prefer her because she always has what they need at accessible prices. She also helps her husband farm afternoons in order to pay the household expenses. María is a woman who is dedicated to her work. She is responsible and eager to get ahead, always hoping for new opportunities that will open the doors to success. She is not willing to give up because she knows that this way  she will be able to earn a more prosperous future. She had some sales losses and she wans to recover but she needs capital for a new investment. That is why she has asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy cilantro, radishes, chipilon, etc. María Cecilia has good payment references and assures us that she will be able to get out of debt and at the same time she hopes she will be able to pay off the dent and she akso hopes she can give he family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cilantro, radishes and chipilin

loans.name: Esther Judith

texts.es: Esther  con su credikiva anterior compró materiales y elaboró bolsos y mochilas de diversos diseños, que vendió muy pronto y aumentó el volumen de su clientela. Hoy se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un  finaciamiento, mediante el cual comprará nuevamente insumos y materiales fabricará nuevos diseños, aprovechando el punto comercial donde hoy está ubicada,que es al margen de la variante,  allí hará la exhibición de mochilas y bolsos, producidas con sus propias manos y con la delicadeza que la caracteriza. Con ello  muy seguramente tendrá cada vez mas reconocimiento de  turistas que por allí transitan. Ella está muy agradecida con los financiadores de Kiva pues la han apoyado con sus préstamos y quiere que lo sepan.
texts.en: With her previous loan, Esther bought materials and made a variety of purses and backpacks, which sold quickly while adding to her customer base. Now she has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for new financing to buy more supplies and materials and create new designs. She is taking advantage of her new location at the corner of the market. Here she will show the finely crafted purses and backbacks she has made by hand. She is certain she will get increasing recognition from tourists who pass by. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and wants them to know this.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and materials and create new designs.

loans.name: Sandro Noberto

texts.es:
El señor Sandro Noberto es soltero, tiene 34 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educacion diversificada, se dedica a la prestación de servicios de jornalero en diferentes hogares, pero ahora querer iniciar su negocio de tejeduría, ya que no ha conseguido un trabajo acorde a su profesión, ya que lleva cinco años también como tejedor de típicos, pero como también como operario.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferente colores y clases, para hacer realidad su propósito de tener su propia producción de tejidos. Espera tener mucha demanda con su nueva producción, y apoyar a sus padres en las diferentes necesidades.
texts.en:
Sandro Noberto is single and is 34 years old.  He studied in a technical education program.  He works as a day laborer in various homes, but now he wants to start his own weaving business, because he has not managed to get a job in his profession even though he has been weaving in traditional styles for 5 years.  He also works as a laborer.

Sandro is requesting a loan to buy yarn in different colors and types so that he can make his goal a reality - to have his own business making woven items.  He hopes to have a lot of demand for his new production, and to support his parents with their various needs.

loans.use: to buy yarn for weaving

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty's Group comprises two hard-working women. Betty is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past two years, Betty has been working hard to manage her salon, where she sells cosmetics and plaits hair. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy oils to use for hair braiding. It will help Betty to generate greater profits and help pay for her sister's schooling. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land to build on. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy oils to use for hair braiding

loans.name: Esthefany Samantha

texts.es:
Esthefany es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeña hija, lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, ahora ella es madre y padres para su pequeña, a pesar de ser tan joven ella es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene mucho deseos por salir adelante; con mucho empeño culmino sus estudios secundarios, lastimosamente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración que tanto deseaba, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta enseñarle a bailar a su hijita y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Esthefany puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos y perfumes, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sus labores de venta, ella cuenta con una pequeña vitrina donde exhibe sus productos y también realiza las ventas de sus productos por catálogos, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Esthefany se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: cosméticos, perfumes y adicionalmente prendas de vestir, como polos, buzos, chompas, entre otras prendas para ampliar su negocio; de esta manera Esthefany tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su sueño de ver convertida a su pequeña en una buena profesional y en una mujer de bien.
texts.en:
Esthefany is 20 and lives with her young daughter in the city of Ica in the Parcona district. For a number of reasons, she sadly separated from her partner, and now she is both mother and father to her child. Despite her youth, she is a very happy, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead. She completed secondary school through her concerted efforts. Because she had to work and earn money to pay expenses, she could not pursue the business administration degree she so desired, though some day she would like to do so. In her free time, she likes to teach her daughter how to dance, and sometimes she prepares the delicious traditional pasta dish "tallarines rojos" to share with her family.

With dedication and enthusiasm, Esthefany started her small business selling cosmetics and perfumes. She begins selling early each morning from a small case where she displays her products, and she also takes catalog orders. She works about 10 hours a day and believes her business succeeds because of her dedication and friendly customer service. 

Esthefany is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide that allows her to buy merchandise for her business: cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing such as polos, overalls, jackets, and other items. Esthefany will have a well-stocked business that she hopes will generate more sales and income. She will keep working and putting her efforts into getting ahead and achieving her dream of seeing her daughter become a professional, upstanding woman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business like cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep would like to take a further loan to buy more food and furniture to expand her business. Diep's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more food and furniture to expand her business.

loans.name: Duhindurimikorere Group

texts.fr:
Godefroid fait partie du groupe Duhindurimikorere. Le nom du groupe signifie « Améliore le niveau du travail ». Il a 35 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 3 mois à 12 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Il a 2 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants .Son niveau d’éducation est de 1 ans de secondaire.

Godefroid est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour renforcer son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Godefroid voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Godefroid is a member of the Duhindurimikorere group.  The name of the group means "improve the work level."  He is 35 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.  He has two people to support other than his children. His level of education is one year of high school.   

Godefroid is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor. To He plans to apply for additional loans to strengthen his rice growing business. In the coming years, Godefroid hopes to become a great rice farmer in his region. He will use his profits to provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 30-year-old young man who is married and has one son.  He is employed and earns a small salary, but that is not enough to cover his family's needs.

Alaa' is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Alaa' to do his reports and help him in his work. This will ensure a better future for Alaa' and improve his family's living conditions. Alaa' is photographed while he is holding the laptop.

loans.use: buy a new laptop

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
Mayram is an entrepreneurial person who is married and has two children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than five years. Little by little, with the passing of the time and years, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad for her work. 

Mayram is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Each month she will make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single young man.  For the past three  years, he has been operating a blacksmith workshop, which has been a profitable project, but is not enough to cover his cost of living.

Mohammad is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a machine for soldering iron. This will improve Mohammad's work quality and increase demand from his customers. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the workshop.

loans.use: buy a solder machine for iron

loans.name: Saadia

texts.en:
Saadia, who appears in the picture, is a 55-year-old woman.  She is a widow and a mother to three sons and two daughters.  For the past four years, Saadia has run a small butcher shop located next to her house. The business has been a profitable project, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the cost of the business.

Saadia is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new refrigerator, which she will use for preserving meat at her butcher shop, and also new butcher shop tools such as knives. This will allow Saadia to expand the scope of her work, improve her business, and increase her family's income.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator and butcher shop tools

loans.name: Gereltsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Gereltsogt, 37, owns a used minivan and runs a passenger transportation business with his wife. He has been operating this business for a decade nonstop and has gained a lot of experience. His business is kind of seasonal and in the summer he usually has a small number of customers. Gereltsogt lives with his wife and his three children in a common apartment in a ger district of Mongolian nomadic yurts in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

His living apartment was built in the socialist era and it does not have separate toilet rooms; it only has earth closets on the outside. As we know, this is very harmful and unhealthy for the environment and the health of inhabitants. So, Gereltsogt and his neighbors jointly decided to install a sanitation system including large iron pipes, container, and other building materials used to install the soil sanitation system.

loans.use: To install the soil sanitation system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed and improve the coop.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is divorced and has 4 children. She must work hard as she is the only one feeding and keeping the family. She is a very careful mother and that’s why her children love her very much. She is also one of the successful business women in her town.  

For more than 6 years Malika has been busy with the selling of shoes. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop her business and in this way improve her family's living condition. She wants to develop the business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This is the fourth loan Malika is requesting from MLO and she feels deeply grateful for the economic support she has received to achieve her goals. She is also grateful to the support received by the members of Imon International as she trusts them and feels at ease with them.

loans.use: buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 67 years old and has four adult and independent children. She lives under the care of her last born child.  Despite her advanced age, Fatuma decided to start a small business to keep herself busy even though she only gets a small income out of it.  Fatuma sells tea leaves from her home, a business she has run for the last 10 years. She will use the loan proceeds to buy stock of tea leaves for resale.

Fatuma's reason for seeking this loan is that she needs to supply her business. She faces challenges in her business due to instability in the local economy. She will use the funds to continue to buy merchandise for resale. Her goal for her business is to expand her inventory and thus be able to serve more customers and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: buy tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Chhoam's Group

texts.en:
Chhoam is a resident from a village in Preahnet Preah district in Banteay Meanchey province.  She is 35 years old and is a married mother of a boy and a girl, both of whom are dependent on the family. To make a living, Chhoam has been in the rice farming business for twelve years. To supplement their income, her family raises some pigs for sale. Through these businesses, they are able to earn approximately KHR 40,000 per day. 

This is the fifth loan for Chhoam's group with VisionFund. The previous loans have enabled Chhoam to generate more income, which was used to support her family well. As a group leader for her fifth group loan, Chhoam will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and a portion of it to buy pig feed. She hopes to earn more income through selling good yield crops as well as healthy pigs so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 49-year-old married man and father of four children. He has worked in fixing car electrical problems since April 2000.  His work is going on just fine, but his family's needs are increasing and he has to be capable of covering them as much as he can.

Husein has to pay for two of his children's university fees. That's why he applied for an educational loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. This loan will  help his family a lot.  He will also invest part of it in buying the necessary books and stationery his children might need.

Husein will work hard on improving his business more and more, to be ready for any extra request in the future.

loans.use: pay university fees for his children

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is 55 years old and married to Bilha.  They are blessed with four children, aged 25, 22, 19  and 17 years. He owns a retail shop where he sells a variety of goods. He ventured into this business four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Bernard wants to purchase basins, buckets, jiko, mattresses and clothes for resale and has requested for his first loan of KES 30,000.  The profit he makes will be ploughed back to his business. His dream is to see his business expand.

loans.use: buy products to resell

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en: Biasha is a woman devoted to her work. She continues selling cashew nuts at the market. She is taking out another loan in the amount of KSH 10,000 to expand on her business. Biasha will use this loan to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts for resale. This way, she will be able to continue providing services to her customers as she increases her income.

loans.use: buy cashews to resell

loans.name: Katy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katy;La socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,a la vez la socia continua con su negocio de venta de carne ,la socia vende en uno de los mercados de Cusco,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos para su negocio .

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Katy belongs to the communal bank "Prosperidad". The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and Cusco department. She is continuing with her business of raising small animals like chickens. She raises them to then sell them to her most frequent customers. At the same time, she is continuing her meat-selling business. She sells in one of the Cusco markets, this being the way that she moves her family forward. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She wants to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family. She is applying for the loan to buy chickens for her business. She thanks those who are a part of this dream using this method and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira and her husband continue to run their bread production business. Several days ago their second child was born and they are extremely happy!

Thanks to their business, Naira is able to provide for her family and her parents-in-law's family as well.

Naira's previous Kiva loan was used to buy flour, oil and yeast for her production. To increase her family’s income Naira intends to diversify her bread production. To do this, she needs a $3,000 loan to buy necessary products for production: a large amount of flour and oil which she will store at her workplace.

loans.use: to buy necessary products for her production: a large amount of flour and oil

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Urbana; La socia continua con su negocio de restaurante ,la socia ofrece almuerzo ,cena y extras,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta mnaera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como aceite y arroz.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Urbana is a member of the “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She continues with her restaurant business.  She sells breakfast, dinner and extras.  She’s been in business for a good length of time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She is a responsible, dedicated person and this is the means by which she supports her family.  She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like oil and rice for her business.  She thanks all those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice and oil.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham es un hombre de 27 años de edad, casado,  tiene un bebe,  vive con su familia en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Abraham se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, él está solicitando un préstamo de un millón de colones 
(¢1.000.000) para comprar la semilla de estos granos, abonos ,  fungicidas, herbicidas  e insecticidas.
Nos comentó que el suyo es el único ingreso que tiene su familia  y  por eso hace su mayor esfuerzo para obtener un producto de calidad y poder venderlo en el mercado local.
Abraham es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal en la Danta, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. El espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Abraham, 27, is married and has a baby.  He lives with his family in a community in south Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agriculture and animal husbandry where tuber, coffee, corn, beans and cattle stand out.

Abraham grows corn and beans and is asking for a one-million colon (¢1.000.000) loan to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, fungicide, herbicide and insecticide.  He commented that his income is his family’s only source of support so he must make a big effort in order to produce high quality crops to be able to sell in the local market.

Abraham is a member of the La Danta communal bank one of EDESA’s 150 member organizations in Costa Rica.  He hopes to continue growing both personally and economically as well as participating actively in his community’s credit organization.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en: Pola is a very hardworking person, jovial and kind to her customers. She tells us that she is still managing her charcoal-selling business. It has been doing well so far. This is why she is not seeing the need to abandon it. With this in mind then, she is requesting a new loan so as to expand it. She intends to purchase sacks of charcoal to restock her store. She is working hard to provide for her young child who is her source of love and her motivation to engage in business; she would like to prepare a good future for him.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to restock her store.

loans.name: Rosalía De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Rosalía de los Ángeles de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus  hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa, vestidos, blusas, faldas, para toda ocasión al gusto del cliente, con material de primera calidad a excelentes precios pero sobre todo siempre a la vanguardia, su negocio esta ubicado en la zona donde reside, es muy conocida y se ha hecho de clientela muy valiosa que le permite estar adelante de la competencia; Rosalía es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor, con muchos sueños que desea realizar, esta dispuesta a lograr el éxito piensa que solo con constancia y mucha motivación podrá alcanzarla, su negocio ha tomada mucho auge y como toda buena comerciante necesita acrecentar la producción pero para eso necesita de suficiente capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas, hilos, agujas, etc. Rosalía de los Ángeles tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Rosalía de los Ángeles, 34, lives with her life companion and their children in a house of their own.  She works making clothes, dresses, blouses and skirts for all occasions to order with top quality materials at excellent prices and in cutting-edge styles.  Her business is located in the same neighborhood where she lives.  She’s very well-known and has acquired a valuable clientele that allows her to stay ahead of the competition.

Rosalía is an active woman who is devoted to her work; she has many dreams to attain yet.  She’s determined to attain success and things that it’s only through constancy and much motivation that she’ll be able to do so.  

Her business has taken off and like all good merchants she wants to increase production but to do so needs capital to invest which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, etc.  Rosalía de los Ángeles has good payment references and unimpeachable morality.  She is sure to be able to repay the loan and at the same time has faith that she will be able to offer her family better quality of life like they so deserve.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: El Sr. Mariano tiene 42 años, tiene cinco hijos que son de las edades de 18, 17, 14, 12 y 7  años, se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Rio Seco,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Mariano va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Mariano enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mariano is 42 years old and has five children, ages 18, 17, 14, 12, and 7. He works in agriculture sowing a variety of vegetables, like potatoes, cassava, and corn on his land, which is in the community of Rio Seco. This loan is the first one from the institution. Mariano is going to use this loan to plant corn and do everything to prepare the land. His reason for applying for this loan is to get resources for planting and to be able to subsist. Mariano confronts challenges in his business like inclement weather that on many occasions ruins the sown fields, and he will use the benefits to improve the quality of life of his customer and his family, since he carries all the home expenses. He is a responsible and hard-working person. He feels grateful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: to plant corn and to help prepare the land.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu is 52 years old, married, and lives with a daughter and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. For the last 12 years, he and his wife have earned a living by selling fruit in a market. Tu is requesting a loan to buy better-quality fruit at competitive prices from wholesalers. He hopes that this will allow him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties that might face his family.

loans.use: to buy better-quality fruit to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy de 49 años de edad es una mujer comerciante que tiene 6 años de experiencia en la venta de productos cosméticos como cremas, lociones, desodorantes y también vende ropa interior,   mediante guías especializadas;  negocio en el cual fue recomendada por una amiga que también se dedicaba a esta actividad. Lucy distribuye los productos después de haber hecho una preventa, para identificar todos los  encargos de sus clientes y telefónicamente hace sus pedidos. Sus principales compradores son vecinos y referidos por estos, a quienes les vende a crédito y algunas veces de contados. Su horario laboral empieza desde muy temprano y termina 8 horas después  y en el intermedio también realiza las tareas propias de su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa interior, cosméticos, bisutería, cremas lociones, desodorante y ropa exterior que ha llegado en sus catálogos con precios especiales y con ellos quiere sorprender a su clientela, que muy feliz estará al conocer que sus productos preferidos, pueden comprarlos fácilmente aun precio que pueden pagar. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su negocio  con un surtido de inventarios  diversos y comprado a buenos precios y esto es justamente lo que conseguirá cuando tenga el dinero en sus manos y pueda elegir mas opciones, como es lo que ocurre con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Lucy, 49, is a merchant; she has six years’ experience selling cosmetics like creams, lotions, deodorants and she also sells underwear via specialized catalogues.  The business was recommended to her by a girlfriend who also was in this type of business.

Lucy distributes her products after having carried out a pre-sale which is when she takes all her customer orders and places her orders by phone.  Her main buyers are her neighbors and people referred by them.  She sells on credit and sometimes for cash.  Her work schedule starts very early and ends 8 hours later and during breaks she does her housework.
