She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy underwear, cosmetics, costume jewelry, creams, lotions, deodorant and underwear that is in her catalogue with special promotional prices; she wants to surprise her customers with them who will be very happy to learn that their favorite products can be purchased for prices they can afford.

Her goal for later on is to expand the business with a more varied inventory of products purchased at good prices which is precisely what she will be able to do when she has the money in hand from her Kiva loan and will be able to choose more options.

loans.use: to buy underwear, cosmetics, costume jewelry, creams, lotions, deodorant, and clothing.

loans.name: Sara Isabel

texts.es: Sara  de 52 años de edad,  es una mujer que enviudó y debió asumir las riendas de su hogar conformado por 4 hijos, hoy en las edades de 13 a 30 años y con quienes sueña verlos convertidos en personas de mucho éxito. Ella con su aptitud hacia las confecciones, desarrolló su creatividad aprendiéndola técnicamente y emprendiendo su propio negocio con el cual generar ingresos suficientes para el buen desempeño de su hogar. En su negocio trabaja sobre medidas a cada cliente y también  a todo costo. Sus clientes le pagan el servicio de contado y ella trabaja continuamente durante todo el día y parte de la noche de lunes a domingo. Sus principales compradores son sus vecinos en el sector donde tiene su taller y algunas personas que han sido referidas por estos y habitan en otros barrios. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar telas, hilos, e insumos y poder fabricar uniformes escolares, que ha convenido  con instituciones y especialmente con  estudiantes.  Esta es la razón por la cual ha accedido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; con este crédito aspira a incrementar su capital de trabajo y responder oportunamente a su clientela que poco a poco está  fidelizando, para sostenerse en  el mercado y empezar a tener cada vez mayores ingresos que beneficien aun mas el bienestar de su familia. .
texts.en:
Sara, 52, is a woman who was widowed and had to take hold of the reins of her home composed of four children whose ages today range from 13 to 30 years and who she dreams with seeing become very successful people.  

With her sewing abilities she developed her creativity having learned technically and opened her own business to generate sufficient income to support her home.  She works to order for each customer and for all budgets.  Her customers pay for services in cash and she works continuously all day and part of the evening Monday through Sunday.  Her main buyers are her neighbors in the sector where her shop is located and also some people referred to her by them who live in other neighborhoods.  

Her greatest challenge at present is having enough working capital to be able to buy fabric, thread and supplies to manufacture school uniforms that she’s contracted to do with schools and especially with the students.  This is why she’s accessing a Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, her first financing to increase working capital and be able to respond to customer demand in a timely fashion so that they will become regular customers and she can stay in business and start each time to earn higher income that will benefit her family’s wellbeing still more.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms. Shazia is married and has five children. She is very hardworking and runs a small business which involves making embroidery laces. She cuts the layers of laces and stitches them onto suits, making them look like fancy dresses. She has done well in this business for the last two years and has established good contacts with different boutiques and tailors. Her husband supports her and helps by buying lace in bulk from a local market. She is requesting a loan for PKR 20,000 to buy more lace. She is very hopeful that her business will grow and she can provide a good like to her family.

loans.use: to buy lace for an embroidery business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 30 years old, single and lives in Kisumu City with one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by operating a retail shop and earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000. She is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to install electricity at her business. She hopes to generate more income after this is done and use the additional profits she earns to expand her shop. Her dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: to install electricity at her business.

loans.name: 33 - Arocagua Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 33-AROCAGUA,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Rosario tiene 23 años casada con un hijo de la edad 2 años,  La Sra. Rosario se dedica  a la   fabricación de letreros ya sea para micros o restaurar antes, tiendas  y kioscos, tiene su taller en la zona de Abra de la ciudad de Santa Cruz este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosario va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de materiales y cartulinas para la fabricación de sus letreros y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de letreros a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Rosario va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material, la Sra. Rosario es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "33 AROCAGUA" communal bank is composed of eight members, six women and two men.  The bank's president is Rosario who is 23 years old and married with a two-year-old son.  Rosario manufactures or restores signs for buses, shops and kiosks.  She has a studio in the Abra neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz.  This loan is her third cycle within the institution.

Rosario will use this loan to purchase materials and make cards for their signs and thus provide a variety of signs to her clientele.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to keep improving her business. Rosario will use the profits to continue shopping for a variety of materials.  Rosario is a hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity given to her and her group mates since in some cases they maintain their families alone.

loans.use: to purchase materials and cardboard for making signs.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El. Sr. Francisco de 68 años de edad es casado y no tiene dependientes económicos. El tiene un pequeño negocio de abarrotes y su esposa vende ropa de segunda mano, calzado y artículos usados, perciben una comisión porque tiene unas maquinas de juegos de videos. El esta solicitando de nuestra ayuda para la compra de mercancía porque quiere surtir su negocio ya que esto es su único ingreso. Francisco quiere seguir luchando por su esposa porque sabe que ella se merece lo mejor. El agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Francisco is 68 years old. He is married and has no dependents. He has a small grocery store and his wife sells used clothes, shoes and other items. They make a commision because they have video games. He is asking for our help to buy merchandise because he wants to stock his business since this is is only source of income. Francisco wants to keep fighting for his wife because he knows that she deserves the best. He will be grateful for any help that can be offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita tiene 53 años casad tiene dos hijos de las edades de 20 y 17 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes,  Que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Isrrael este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Margarita utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de mercadería abarrotes por mayor como arroz y azúcar,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, la Sra. Margarita enfrenta retos en su negocio que son desbalances en la economía local, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería surtida. Su deseo por su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida y así de esta manera incrementas su clientela y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en: Margarita, 53, is married and has two children whose ages are 20 and 17 years. She sells basic staple items in her grocery store located in the Israel zone.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Margarita will use this loan to buy merchandise like rice and sugar at wholesale.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the need to stock her store.  The business challenge Margarita faces is local economic fluctuations.  She will use profits to continue to buy varied merchandise.  Her wish for her business is that her store becomes larger and better stocked so that her customers will increase and as a result so will her profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sokhon's Group

texts.en: Sokhon, aged 33 years old and the mother of one daughter, is a rural villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang district, Cambodia. To earn a daily living, she has been raising pigs for more than four years. This is the main source of income, and her husband supplements the family's income as a fisherman. The current business earns her about 22,000 KHR. For the four loan cycles that she has been with Kiva partner VisionFund, she has paid back all the loans with success, maintaining a better standard of living for her family. Now, she has formed a group of three female members to seek a new loan and she is the group leader. This is the fifth loan cycle for her and one of her fellow group members, while it is the first loan cycle for the remaining member. For her, the loan portion will be used to buy more pigs for raising. She hopes to raise her pig healthfully so as to sell it for a high price to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for raising

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms Shazia is a young woman who is married. She knows a lot about stitching clothing, so she decided to use her skills to make extra money for her household. This is why she bought a sewing machine and started stitching clothing for her customers. She has been doing this for the last four years. She has requested for a loan of Rs. 10,000 to buy raw materials, including lace, buttons and embroidery for shirts, so that she can complete the orders which she has received.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for a sewing business.

loans.name: 74-25 De Febrero Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 74-25 DE FEBRERO está  compuesto por diez integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Irma ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Irma  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio y  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Irma va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Irma  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank 74-25 De Febrero is made up of 10 members, all of whom are women. 

The president of the bank is Irma. She makes a living selling food in her sales stall located in the same neighborhood that she lives in. This is her second loan with the institution. Irma will use the loan to purchase table and chairs for her business. This way she will be able to provide more comfort for customers. She is requesting the loan to be able to continue improving her business. Irma will use the funds to continue purchasing supplies and therefore improve her income. Her dream for her business is to have a restaurant and be able to provide better service to her customers. 

Irma is a hardworking person. She is happy to have the opportunity that has been given to her and her fellow group members because in many cases they are people who are the sole bread winners for their families.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Ángela Rosario

texts.es: Ángela Rosario de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; Ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y salado, semita, quesadilla, torta, pastelitos de pollo, pan francés entre otros, tiene ya varios años de trabajar en la panadería y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia, pues aprendió el oficio desde muy joven, el negocio esta ubicado en su residencia y ya tiene mucha  clientela pues elabora el pan mas delicioso de la zona hecho con material de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable siempre esta a la orden de las personas; Ángela es una mujer trabajadora, activa, y motivada a salir adelante siempre esta buscando alternativas que le abran paso a oportunidades que la lleven al éxito piensa que su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia, como toda comerciante quiere aumentar su producción para así poder aumentar sus ganancias pero necesita de capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, levadura, pollo, azúcar, miel, leche, etc. Ángela Rosario tiene muy buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia que es lo mas importante para el.
texts.en:
Ángela Rosario, 43, lives with her life companion and their children.  She sells savory and sweet bread, semitas [type of bread roll], cheese rolls, cakes, chicken pies, French bread, among others.  She’s been working baking for several years and she’s gained much experience doing so because she learned the occupation while still very young.  The bakery is located at home and she has many customers because she makes the zone’s most delicious bread with top quality ingredients and at affordable prices; in addition service is unequalled, she is always at people’s service.

Ángela is a hardworking, active woman who is motivate to get ahead and always on the lookout for alternatives that will lead to opportunities for success.  She believes that the greatest secret is perseverance and like all merchants would like to increase production in order to increase profits but needs capital to invest which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy flour, yeast, chicken, sugar, honey, milk, etc.

Ángela Rosario has very good payment references and an unimpeachable moral code.   She is sure that she will be able to repay the loan and at the same time has faith that she will be able to bring economic security to her home and a better quality of life for her family which is what’s most important for her.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Bayarjargal, 48, is requesting a loan to complete building her family house. She lives with her family in a ger district of Mongolian nomadic yurts in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She owns a small common apartment with 20 rooms on her land plot and she leases it to the citizens from rural areas. Currently her family is living in one of the rooms and it is not so spacious to live in with her big family. Last year, she and her husband decided to build their own family house and started it. But due to the money shortage, her housebuilding has been stopped in the last months. She planned to build her new house with wall insulation and to install an electric heating panel to assist or replace the coal-fired stove in winter. Now she needs to buy some building materials and an electric heating panel for building her family house.

loans.use: To buy some building materials and an electric heating panel for building her family house.

loans.name: Sithet's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother living in a rural village located in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sithet is 34 years old and has one dependent son who is still in school. The main source of the family’s income is bean planting on 1 hectare of farmland, which she has been in for almost ten years. This business earns her about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. The low price of her crop yield is her main challenge.

This is the first loan for Sithet with VisionFund while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now leading a group of two, Sithet, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her planting business and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her crop yield so as to earn a good living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her planting business

loans.name: Yacuiba - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento YACUIBA-26,  Está  compuesto por once integrantes nueve mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Juana tiene 32 años, y un hijos que son de las edades de cinco años,  La Sra. Juana se dedica  a la   venta de ropa interior lencería, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa interior por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Juana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa interior, la Sra. Juana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The “Yacuiba-26” communal bank has 11 members, nine women and two men.  The bank president is Juana, 32.  She has a five-year-old son.  Juana sells lingerie.  She has a permanent stall in one of the city of La Paz’s busiest markets where she sells her products.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Juana will use this loan to buy underwear at wholesale in order to have a variety of clothes on offer for her customers thus increasing her profits.  The reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving the business.  Juana will use profits to continue to buy a variety of underwear.  Juana is a very hardworking person who feels happy about the opportunity provided to her and her fellow group members because in some cases they are their families’ sole source of support.

loans.use: to buy lingerie at wholesale.

loans.name: Myrian Patricia

texts.es: Myrian a sus 30 años es una madre de familia separada que vive con sus familiares. Ella tiene en el norte de la ciudad una tienda de venta de pollos la cual inicio hace 3 años con un capital de $ 500 con el cual alquilo un local lo adecuo y empezó negocio. Actualmente tiene mucha clientela por lo que ha podido invertir poco a poco en la compra de 2 congeladores. El negocio lo maneja junto a su cuñado atendiendo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 6 de la tarde vendiendo principalmente pollo ya sea entero o por libras y huevos. En esta ocasión espera obtener el préstamo ya que desea poder comprar pollos, huevos y queso para la ampliar sus ventas de esta manera incrementar su negocio y poder seguir creciendo mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Myrian is a 30 year old mother. She is separated and lives with relatives.  In the northern part of town she has a store where she sells chicken. She opened it 3 years ago with $500 in capital. With that she rented a locale, outfitted it and started the business. Right now she has a lot of customers and so she has been able to invest little by little by buying 2 freezers. She manages the business with her brother in law, open from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening, selling mainly chicken, whole or by the pound, as well as eggs. At this time, she hopes to obtain the loan because she wants to buy chicken, eggs and cheese to increase her sales and in this way grow her business and be able to keep growing, improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en: Ara makes a living by farming in a village called Shikahogh. On this farm he breeds cows, calves and chickens. He also rents a plot of land where he grows wheat.  He keeps part of the milk, meat, eggs and wheat he produces for his family's needs, and sells the rest in a local market. Ara is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. His older son is employed and his younger children are in school. Ara has received three previous loans from Nor Horizon, and has always made his payments on time. He is requesting a new loan, for 500,000 AMD, to organize his harvest and mow grass which he uses as fodder for his farm animals. He will also use this loan to buy diesel fuel, rent a combine, pay for a driver and transport wheat from the field to his granary.

loans.use: to buy fuel, organize his harvest and produce fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Sadelly Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Sadelly tiene 30 tiene cuatro hijos que son de las edades de 17, 15, 7  y 5 años, ella se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y Maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Rio Seco, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sadelly va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maíz  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,  la Sra. Sadelly  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia ya que ella corre con todos los gastos del hogar, la Sra. es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sadelly, age 30, has four children, ages 17, 15, 7, and 5.  She works in agriculture, and she grows a variety of vegetables, potatoes, yucca, and corn.  The parcel of land where she grows her products is in the Rio Seco community.

This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  Sadelly will use this loan to plant corn and to do what it takes to prepare the land.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to get resources for planting and to be able to get by.

Sadelly faces a challenge in her business, which is the inclement weather that many times ruins the sown fields.  She will use the profits to improve her family’s quality of life because she is responsible for all of the household expenses.

She is a responsible and hard-working person, and she is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to plant corn and to do what it takes to prepare the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Ms. Bilqees is a widow and after her husband's death she faced huge difficulties as she has a child which is disabled. After the death of her husband she moved to her parent’s house and started stitching on her sewing machine. 

She had desires to pass on this art to other females of the community, so she also opened a vocational school and bought more sewing machines. Currently she has plans to further enhance her business and also to buy more machines, spare parts and raw materials so she requires Rs. 20,000 (Pakistani rupee, PKR) for making her dream come true.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines, spare parts and raw materials

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn is aged 64 and widowed. She lives with her seven children in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district. All her children have their own employment from which they make a living. For the last thirty years, Vorn has been farming rice and raising chickens. To better support herself and her family, she also sells coconuts to earn extra income. Her business faces the challenges of flooding and drought. 
	
Vorn's group consists of two members who live in the same village. She successfully used her past four loans to improve her livelihood, and is now requesting a fifth loan for her group with VisionFund.  Vorn, who is the leader of her group, will use her portion of the loan to buy more coconuts for her business, and also to buy a sewing machine for her daughter. She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her coconut selling business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for her business

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 27-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is widowed but takes care of a 6-year-old child.

Carolyne operates a tailoring business, a business she has been doing for the last eight years. She makes a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She joined KADET LTD recently and has been awarded with a first loan, which she will use to buy textile materials for dressmaking. Her profits will be used to expand her tailoring business.

Her dream is to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy textile materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Joe Gonzalo

texts.es: Joe se dedica a la venta de huevos por mayor y menor, el trabajo lo realiza por medio de recorridos que hace en la camioneta de su papá entregando y ofertando el producto, tiene varios años con el negocio el cual le ha dado buenas ganancias. Sus clientes en la mayoría son las tiendas por el barrio o los restaurant ya que ellos venden a diario por lo que su venta es diaria así como el pago ya que no da crédito. Uno de sus mayores inconvenientes son los caminos los cuales no están pavimentos lo que le ocasiona molestias y perdidas porque su producto es delicado y se rompen con facilidad lo que le ocasiona pérdidas. Con el crédito que solicita espera poder comprar huevos para tener en stock, le gustaría ampliar su negocio ya que le gustaría tener a su lado a su familia.
texts.en: Joe works selling eggs wholesale and retail. He carries out his work on routes that he drives in his father's truck, delivering and offering the product. He's been working several years with the business, which has given him a great income. Most of his customers are the stores in the neighborhood or the restaurants. They sell every day, which means he has sales every day as well as payment, since he doesn't give credit. One of his greatest challenges is the roads, which aren't paved, which causes him problems and losses because his product is delicate and they break easily, which causes him losses. With the loan he is applying for, he hopes to be able to buy eggs to have in stock. He would like to grow his business since he would like to have his family by his side.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El señor Dionicio nació  en Valle grande, es casado tiene cinco hijos ya mayores, el se dedica a la agricultura, tiene su parcela en pampa el Coscal y también se dedica a la ganadería, la zona donde el trabaja se encuentra a 42 km de San Luis en la provincia Florida de la Santa Cruz, donde el tiene su parcela, donde vive y trabaja, el siembra maíz, arroz, y también un poco de yuca, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz Todo lo que el cosecha lo saca a vender en el mercado de el Torno, del productor al consumidor, ya viene trabajando con Emprender hace 4 créditos, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que emprender  nuevamente le esta dando para mejorar su calidad de vida.Con el anterior vcredito le fue muy bien por este motivo solicita este otro credito para incrementar su produccion su siembra y posterior cosecha.
texts.en:
Dionicio was born in Valle Grande, is married, and has 5 grown children. He is a farmer who has a parcel of land in the Coscal region. Dionicio also raises cattle. The zone where he works is 42 kilometers from San Luis in Florida province of Santa Cruz. There where he lives and works Dionicio has his parcel. He plants corn, rice, and also a little yuca. The loan funds will be used  to buy seeds for sowing corn. Everything he harvests will be taken to the market of Torno to be sold directly from the producer to the consumer.

Dionicio has been working with Emprender during 4 loan cycles and he is very proud of Emprender's help. Once again he is working to improve his quality of life. Things went very well with his last loan.  From a similar motive, he is soliciting another loan to increment this harvest's production and the subsequent harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing corn.

loans.name: Aba Efua

texts.en:
For the past 12 years, Aba Efua has been cooking banku (fermented maize and cassava dough). She serves it with hot pepper sauce and fried fish at Ayinase near Elmina. 

She is a widow taking care of four children who are currently in school. With her income, she pays for their school fees and takes care of the house. 

She hopes to expand her banku business and so needs a loan to enable her to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, cassava dough, and firewood to make her food production easier. 

Her future plan is to build a better place to host her customers.

loans.use: to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, cassava dough, and firewood to make her food production easier.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms. Nazia is a married woman and she has one child. She is trying hard to improve her standard of living, to provide better education to her child. She is a very energetic lady. 

Ms. Nazia had the dream to be a business woman and so she learned the art of being a beautician. Now its been eight years of her as a beautician and she has a beauty parlor. Her success also drives other females to own their separate businesses. Currently she requires Rs. 20,000 (Pakistani Rupee, PKR) for the purchase of material required for her beauty parlor.

loans.use: To purchase material required for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic utensils for selling at a profit.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 50-year-old lady from Nyalenda, Kisumu and is married to Samuel. They have four children, and their ages are 7, 13, 18, and 20.

Elizabeth operates a cereal-selling business, which she has been doing for the last 10 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She recently joined KADET LTD and has been awarded her first loan, which she will use to buy maize, rice, and green grams to sell. 

Her profits will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy maize, rice, and green grams to sell

loans.name: Orng's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Orng is aged 46 and has two children. She has struggled to earn her living through farming rice on a three-hectare area of farmland. Having been in this business for more than thirty years, she is able to earn about 46,700 KHR (Cambodian Riel) per day to support her daily living. 

Orng received her first loan with VisionFund, has done four cycles already and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her improve her living condition. As the leader, she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion of 600,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to produce more rice from her current business to improve her lifestyle and set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Aged 30 years old, Sokheng is a married mother of two dependent children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are still in school. 

Rice farming on two hectares of farmland is the main source of the family’s income. Sokheng also has been supplementing the income by growing beans and sesame for ten years. Drought is the main challenge for her business. 

Sokheng’s group consists of two members who are both female and live in the same village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Now she and her group member are applying for the second loan cycle of KHR 1,200,000 each with Kiva partner VisionFund. 

As the leader, Sokheng is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from the crop so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Akos

texts.en: Akos is a food vendor. She sells different kinds of foods in Elmina. Some of the foods that she sells are: banku (fermented maize and cassava dough),  cooked yam, cooked rice, etc. In the picture, she is standing close to her food. She is married and has 5 children.  Her husband is a driver. She helps to pay the utility bills as a way of assisting her husband. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice, maize, and other ingredients needed to prepare her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to pay for a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, maize, and other ingredients needed to prepare her foods to sell

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is 40 years old and married with two children; their ages are 1 and 8 years old. He sells cheese. He does this from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day of the week except for weekends. He currently employs five people to help him, and he has eleven years of experience in this work. 

Justin has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantity of cheese to sell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of cheese to sell

loans.name: Liliam Aracely

texts.es: Liliam tiene en Libertad un restaurant el cual inicio  hace varios años porque necesitaba trabajar y cuidar de sus hijos sin problemas ya que es separada. Pasando el tiempo le empezó a gustar mas su negocio hasta que pudo abrir un pequeño local el cual arrienda para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El negocio lo atiende junto a su hija y otra persona quien prepara los alimentos que se van a vender, su jornada de trabajo empieza desde la madrugada cuando sale a comprar los ingredientes y continua durante el resto del día. En su local solo brinda el servicio de desayuno y almuerzo. Como sus dos hijos aun se encuentran estudiando necesita aumentar sus ventas es por esto que solicita el crédito para mejorar la atención a sus clientes comprando mesas, sillas y accesorio para ampliar mas el local.
texts.en:
Liliam has a restaurant in Libertad. She started it several years ago because she needed to work and take care of her children, because she is separated. 

After a while, she started liking her business even more, and she could open small premises that she rents to offer a better service to her customers. She takes cares of the business with her daughter and another person who prepares the food to be sold. Her working day starts at dawn when she goes to buy the ingredients and continues throughout the day. In her restaurant she only provides breakfast and lunch.

Her two children are still studying so she needs to increase her sales, and that's why she is applying for a loan. She wants to improve the service to her customers by buying tables, chairs, and accessories to expand further the premises.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and accessories

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married to a farmer, and they both live together with their two children in Enyinase, which is near Elmina. Ama is a fruit vendor who sells watermelons. She has been doing this for 12 years now. Ama uses her income to help pay for her household expenses and the upkeep of her family. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of fruit to sell. With her profit, she will expand her businss.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es: Dorila vive en la ciudad turística de Libertad, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios de agua, luz, camino pavimentado. EL negocio de venta de hamacas lo aprendió de su esposo ya que el realizaba este trabajo y le enseño a su hijo quien posteriormente a ella, ahora es ella quien las confecciona bajo pedido ya que su confección demanda tiempo y material y a veces los clientes no quieren pagar su costo. Como su esposo tuvo por mucho tiempo el negocio tiene una variedad bien amplia de clientes por eso la va bien en su negocio. Hace poco le solicitaron un pedido grande de este producto y es por esto que solicita el crédito ya que desea comprar el hilo que es la materia prima para la confección de las hamacas. Su meta a futuro es seguir trabajando por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Dorila lives in the tourist city of Libertad, Her house is made of cement and she has access to all the utilities of water, electricity and paved roads.  
She learnt about the business of hammock sales from her husband since he was the one who was carrying on the business. He taught his son who later taught her.

Now she is the one who makes them according to demand since their production requires time and material and sometimes the customers do not want to pay the costs. 

As her husband had the busines for a long time it had a wide variety of customers and for this reason it is going well for her. Recently she received a large order for this product and so she is asking for the loan as she wants to buy the thread which is the primary material required for the production of hammocks. Her goal for the future is to continue working for a long time.

loans.use: to buy nylon thread.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela esta nuevamente solicitando un crédito para mejoramiento a su vivienda. Con varios préstamos le ha hecho mejorar a su casa. 
Esta solicitando le crédito para terminar los acabados del interior y exterior ya que le esta haciendo falta terminar la recamara de sus hijos y poderla acondicionar ya que tiene un hijo que problemas de salud y requiere de ciertas comodidades.
Doña Graciela trabaja en limpieza de una casa y su esposo le manda dinero ya que esta trabajando fuera de la ciudad. Su hijo el mayor ya termino su carrera profesional es maestro, con estos ingresos podrá pagar el crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y que tengan un patrimonio seguro y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Graciela is again applying for a loan for improvements to her home.  She has done improvements to her home with several loans.  

She is applying for the loan to complete interior and exterior finishing work, as she is needing to finish her children's bedroom and equip it, as she has a son with health problems who requires certain comforts. 

Graciela works cleaning a house, and her husband sends her money as he is working out of town.

Her eldest son has already completed his professional degree and is a teacher. 

With this income she will be able to pay off the loan, improve her family's quality of life, and ensure they have a safe property that is in good repair.

loans.use: To pay for exterior and interior finishing.

loans.name: Thavoery's Group

texts.en: Thavoery, 32, is a mother of two dependent daughters who are still in school. To earn an income for her family, she has been running a small business welding iron windows, doors, and fences. She is able to earn about 32,000 KHR per day. Thavoery is the leader of her group, which consists of two female members who are second-time borrowers with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has been with VisionFund for five years. After successfully paying her previous loan, she feels empowered to gradually improve her family’s living conditions. She will use her portion of the loan to buy welding materials such as rods, wire, torches, oxygen cylinders, etc.  She hopes to earn more income from this business so as to sustain her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy welding materials such as rods, wire, torches, oxygen cylinders, etc.

loans.name: Chantho's Group

texts.en:
Chantho is 27 years old and lives with her four children in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province. Of her four children, two are in school, while the others are under school age. She earns a living by buying and selling vegetables, and her husband is a worker in another province. She has been in this business for four years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Chantho is the leader of her group, which consists of three members who live in the same village. She and one other member are on their seventh loan cycle with VisionFund, while the third is receiving her first loan. The past loans that Chantho paid back in full to VisionFund have helped her improve her business.  She will use her portion of this loan to buy more vegetables. With this loan, she hopes to expand her vegetable selling business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Libertad De San Francisco Group

texts.es:
La señora Maura Patricia esta casada, tiene 36 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de pants y de trajes deportivos, inicio este trabajo siendo operaria en casa de de un vecino y hasta el momento lleva 12 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabajo en el mantenimiento de caminos (trabaja para el Estado).

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que sera utilizado para la compra de telas de varios colores, y así aumentar su volumen de producción de pants y trajes deportivos para niños; en el futuro espera tener un local de atención al cliente para su producción. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la confección de playeras, y prendas deportivas.
texts.en:
Maura Patricia is married and is 36 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has 5 children, 3 of which are studying. 

She has 12 years of experience making pants and sports uniforms. She began this work as a seamstress for a neighbor. She counts on the support of her husband who works in road maintenance for the State. 

She is organizing a group to request a loan to purchase fabrics of various colors to increase the volume of production of pants and sports uniforms for children. In the future she hopes to have a storefront to distribute her products directly to the public. 

The other members of the group make t-shirts and sporting goods.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make pants and sports uniforms.

loans.name: Milton Rafael

texts.es: Milton siempre ha sido un hombre de trabajo, a sus 48 años ha tenido varios negocios en distintas ciudades. Actualmente reside en las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil donde tiene un bazar en el cual vende diversos artículos desde papelería hasta artículos para regalos. Su experiencia en el comercio es de varios años solo que anteriormente el tenia una ferretería en Libertad pero por cuestiones familiares decidió vivir en Guayaquil así que liquido su negocio y abrió el bazar.  El atiende el negocio sin ayuda desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6:30 de la tarde, le gusta porque lo distrae y se siente útil. Con el crédito que está solicitando comprara cartulinas, cuadernos, laminas, peluches, tarjetas y recargas celulares. Espera que el negocio crezca para pagar sin problemas las cuotas del préstamo y seguir adelante con el mismo ya que es el sustento de su familia
texts.en:
Milton has always been a man who works. At 48, he has had several businesses in various cities. Currently, he lives in Las Orquídeas, in the northern section of Guayaquil, where he has a school supplies store where he sells various items from stationery to gift items. 

He has several years of experience as a merchant, only previously, he had a hardware store in Libertad. For family reasons he decided to live in Guayaquil, so he liquidated his business and opened a school supplies store.  

He runs the store without assistance from 7:00 in the morning to 6:30 in the afternoon, and likes it because he enjoys it and feels useful. With the loan he is applying for, he will buy cards, notebooks, wall charts, stuffed animals, as well as cell phone cards and top-ups.  

He hopes his business grows so that he can pay the loan installments with no difficulties, and keep his store going, as it is how he supports his family.

loans.use: To buy cards, notebooks, wall charts, stuffed animals, as well as cell phone cards and top-ups.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Mom is 43 years old. She is a married mother of seven children, five (two daughters and three sons) of whom are dependent on her and help in the family’s business. 

She has been in rice farming on two hectares of farmland and has been supplementing the family’s income through raising pigs for eight years to make a living. 

The current business earns her approximately KHR 20,000 per day and she manages to save about KHR 5,000 each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield caused by the drought is the main challenge for her business. 

This is the second loan cycle for Mom’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her to better support the family. 

Now she and her group members are asking for a new loan in the amount of KHR 1,200,000 each. As the leader, Mom is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the current businesses so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland, and more pigs for raising.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married to a farmer and has five children. Aba sells peppers at Eyinase. She has been selling peppers for the past eight years. Aba uses her income to support her family and pay her children's school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more peppers for sale. With the new profit, Aba will buy peppers in bulk for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers for sale.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a hardworking businessman. He runs a taxi transport business to earn a living. He operates his business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. Since Titus became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained on financial management skills. He dreams of expanding his business and employing people in the future. Titus needs a loan of 20,000 KES to service his vehicle.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en: Channy is a 35-year-old married mother of one daughter and one son and lives in the village located in the Sangke District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been in rice farming and cassava planting for several years to meet the daily basic needs of her family while her husband works as a paid worker for additional income. From the current business, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Channy has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped her relieve her family’s burden and enabled her to buy a motorbike to support her business. Now, she is leading the group of two to request a new loan. As the leader, Channy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs in plowing. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and to pay the plowing fee for her rice field.

loans.name: Minzionmahu Group

texts.fr: MINZIONMAHU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Ibilola Armande Isabelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Edouard. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ibilola Armande Isabelle a peu fréquenté l’école. Ibilola Armande Isabelle vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de six ans, Ibilola Armande Isabelle vend des chaussures, divers articles et des boissons à son domicile. Ibilola Armande Isabelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du dans sa région. C’est la cinquième fois que Ibilola Armande Isabelle et les autres membres du groupe MINZIONMAHU sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MINZIONMAHU is a group of three persons whose members are friends residing in the same district. The group's representative, Ibilola Armande Isabelle (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 41 years old and married to a man named Edouard. The couple have four children, not all in school but all in their  care. Ibilola Armande Isabelle has had little schooling. She lives together with her children and husband, and along with him, she ensures that the different household expenses are covered.

For nearly six years, Ibilola Armande Isabelle has been selling shoes, a variety of goods, and beverages out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market in her region.  

This is the fifth time that Ibilola Armande Isabelle and the other members of the group MINZIONMAHU have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their business and responding better to the requirements of their customers. The loans received previously were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and various goods to sell from home

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 33-year-old widow. She had difficult times after the death of her husband. She decided not to marry but to strive for a better future for her two daughters and one son. She started her business of sewing. 
She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is able to fulfill basic necessities for her children including food, healthcare and education. She is also accountable to improving their standard of living. 
It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. Through the support of Kashf Foundation, she is fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her children’s education. Now, she has requested a loan of Rs.30000/- to buy raw material including cloth, threads and needles. In this way she can handle the growing demand of her clothes in the market and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads and needles.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: For the past 20 years, Mary has been cooking banku and serving it with a hot pepper sauce and fried fish in Ayinase, which is near Elmina. She is married to a driver and has 4 children who are currently in school.  She hopes to expand her banku business, so she needs a loan which will be used to buy maize, peppers, tomatoes, cassava dough, and firewood to make her food production easier. Her goal is to build a better place to host her customers.

loans.use: To buy maize, peppers, tomatoes, cassava dough, and firewood to make her food production easier

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and stew in Enyinase.  Habiba has been selling waakye for the past 6 years now. She is married to a welder and has 5 children.  Habiba assists her husband in paying for their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, beans, and fish to prepare her waakye to sell.  Habiba will use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, beans, and fish to prepare her waakye to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a hardworking and enterprising woman who sells second-hand clothes at the market. She is married but has no child yet.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Vivian is working hard to own a retail shop in the near future. Vivian will invest this loan in the purchase of more bales of clothes for sale. This is due to the fact that her customers have requested some more fashion styles in clothes. She does not want to let them down.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Chikophe

texts.en: Chikophe is taking out another loan so as to expand his transportation business. With the loan, he plans to service his motorcycle. His aim is to own a vehicle. His wife is a very supportive person who is busy with her tailoring business. Together, they make sure that they work towards the progress of their family. Chikophe is so grateful for the support given. He promises to pay this loan on time so as to stand a better chance of requesting more loans.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy groceries to sell and fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat is 34 years old and married. She previously sold food items but now she is going to change her business, as she doesn’t get enough income from her last business.  Mahfirat is going to start a new business selling stationery. She studied at the course ‘To get a success’ from a women's organization and got enough skills about business.  She dreams of expanding her business and becoming prosperous in the future. 

Mahfirat needs a loan to of 2500 Somoni to buy stationery for her new business. She is looking for your help.

loans.use: buy stationery to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has four children.  She is a small trader and fish monger. She sells onions, okra, tomatoes, and fish at Eyinase near Elmina, which she has done for 3 years now.  Her husband is a farmer. She adds her income to that of her husband’s to pay school fees and utility bills. 

Ama will use this loan to purchase additional bags of onions, fish, okra and tomatoes for sale. With the new profits, Ama plans to build a shop.

loans.use: buys onions, fish, okra and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Phea is aged 45 and is a villager from Battambang province's Sangke district.  She is married and has two children who have their own employment. Phea is a rice farmer while her husband is a paid worker in the local area. Having been in this business for more than ten years, she is able to earn about 46,600 KHR per day to support her expenses and can afford to save about 16,000 KHR per day. 

This the second micro loan for Phea's group of two and they had completely paid back the first loan to VisionFund. The first loan has helped her relieve her family's financial burden and increased her business. To support her current business, Phea and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 800,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for gasoline to pump water into her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthily and hopes to increase her rice yields so as to make her  living better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells gari at Enyinase near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and together they have nine children. Efua uses her income to contribute to familial financial responsibilities, such as food purchases and school fees. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. She plans to expand her gari business with her new profit.

loans.use: buy gari to sell

loans.name: Merveille Group

texts.fr: MERVEILLE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Akossouwa Anasthasie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Félix. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Akossouwa Anasthasie a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Akossouwa Anasthasie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Akossouwa Anasthasie vend de l’huile à moteur et du gasoil à son domicile. Akossouwa Anasthasie s’approvisionne auprès d’une berge lagunaire du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Akossouwa Anasthasie et les autres membres du groupe MERVEILLE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MERVEILLE is a group of three persons whose members are friends residing in the same district. The group's representative, Akossouwa Anasthasie  (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 43 years old and married to a retailer named Félix. The couple have two children, all in school and in their  care. In addition to their children, the couple have another child to support. Akossouwa Anasthasie lives together with her children and husband, and along with him, she ensures that the different household expenses are covered.

For nearly ten years, Akossouwa Anasthasie has been selling motor oil and diesel fuel out of her home. She gets her supplies from along side a lagoon in Benin. 

This is the first time that Akossouwa Anasthasie and the other members of the group MERVEILLE have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their business and responding better to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to purchase containers of motor oil and diesel fuel to sell

loans.name: Women At Work Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Women At Work” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Aminata is the leader of this group.  Aminata is 28 years old, married and has 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Aminata sells uncooked rice and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying bags of rice to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: The grocery shop above is owned by Florence. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Some of the items in her grocery shop are soap, powdered milk, Milo, etc.  Her business is 8 years old.  Florence uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the home. Florence will use the loan to purchase other types of groceries to bring variety to her shop. She plans to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: restock her grocery store

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en: Mwanamkuu used her previous loan to pay school fees for her child who attend school.  Today she is requesting a new loan to establish a fuel selling stall to sell fuel to her neighbours.  She will buy 5 gallons (20 litres) of paraffin fuel for resale. This will allow her to have a stock of inventory, get discounts for quick payment, and offer varied products to her customers, who have become accustomed to her services.

loans.use: buy fuel to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oil and rice.

loans.name: Kimleang's Group

texts.en:
Kimleang is a resident of a rural area located in Battambang province. She supports her family by farming rice and growing red corn. Given that her family has so many members, the income generated from her agricultural business is not sufficient to support her family; therefore, during her spare time, she plants corn for others at a fee. 

This is Kimleang's fifth loan while her other member is new to VisionFund. As she has a good record with Kiva's field partner, Kimleang was appointed to be the group leader. Kimleang used her portion of her fifth loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings and to spend the remainder on labor fees, as she hires some people to help prepare her farmland. Kimleang hopes this loan will allow her to grow good yield crops, and hence, sell the output for a good price. As a result, she hopes her family will live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings and to spend on farmland preparation

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 38 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Msambweni, Mombasa. She has been selling groceries for more than two years. Her husband is a businessman.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Hadija is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she will earn more profits to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn bachelors' degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build another food stall business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 54 years old and lives in a small village in the Martvili district. She is married and lives with her husband.  Izolda and her husband earn a living through an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow nuts and persimmons. Izolda sells nuts and dried persimmons at the local open market. The family is involved in dairy business, as well. They own a milking cow and produce cheese. The cheese is sold in the nearby villages. In addition, the state provides Izolda and her husband with a retirement pension. Izolda works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to save or improve her family's living conditions. 

Izolda requested a loan to repair her sleeping room, which is damaged and uncomfortable. With this loan she will be able to purchase building materials. Izolda and her husband will be able to spend their evenings after a hard day of work in a more comfortable environment. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her sleeping room.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda, 35, is married and has five children, four of whom -- one daughter and three sons, are dependent on her. She earns a living through farming rice while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She has been in this business for six years and is challenged with a lack of working capital and low yield. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day. 

Chenda's group consists of three members who are all women.  She and another member are second-cycle loan clients while the other is with VisionFund just this cycle. The first loan from VisionFund has helped her increase her family's income and improved their livelihood. As the leader, Chenda is leading her group to apply for this loan.  She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and make her living even better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married to a farmer with 3 children. She is a food vendor.  She cooks rice and fish stew for sale. Ama  uses her income to assist her husband to pay utility bills.  Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, fish, tomatoes and cooking oil to prepare the food for sale. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to cook food for sale

loans.name: Thov's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Mongkul Borey, Thov is 40 years old and married with three children. To make a living, he has been farming rice in the local area for twenty years while his wife is a fish seller in the local market. The main challenge for his family's business is the low yield from his rice farming business which affected his family's income. 

Thov's group consists of three members who live in the same village. He and another member are fourth-cycle clients while one is a second-cycle client with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past loans have helped him improve his family's livelihood.  Now he is leading his group to apply for a new loan. Thov will use his portion of  the loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland and to buy more fish for his wife's business. With this loan, he hopes to increase his family's current business so as to earn a larger income to better his living condition.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his farm and fish to sell

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is doing a business to supply snacks and grocery items to the local retail market to support her husband.  She understands the fact that her husband working alone will not be able to meet the expenses of her household with the educational needs of her children. 

Due to her good past experience with Kashf Foundation, Salma requested for a loan of RS 20,000 to purchase more snacks and grocery items to sell. This will enable them to sustain their business and hence better support their family.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a single gentleman who is 24 years old. He supports his parents as well as his younger siblings. He operates a motorbike transport business in the Narok area and has been running the business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000. 

Samuel has taken this loan of KES 75,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase another motorbike. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for his school-going siblings.

His dreams is to improve his family's living standards and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Sokhhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhhom, 42, lives in a rural area of Battambang province's Ratanak Mondul district, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is married with five children, only two of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are peasants who grow rice and red maize as a primary business, and she also sells dessert in the local area to earn more income. The current business earns her about 10,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

This is a group loan for Sokhhom's group with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She and another member have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, while the other member has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles already. The first loan has helped Sokhhom to improve her livelihood and afford sufficient food to eat. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor. Now, she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. She hopes to increase her crops and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en:
Bo is aged 60 and is living in a rural village in the Mongkul Borei district.  She is widowed and has six children. She earns a living through raising pigs in the local area and sometimes she works for others for a fee to earn extra income. Having been in this business for fifteen years, she is able to earn about 34,000 KHR per day to make her living. 

Bo has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and she had completely paid back the previous loans, which have helped her improve her  livelihood.  Now requesting a new loan, Bo, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more piglets and feed for her pigs. She hopes to raise her pigs to be fat and healthy and also hopes to earn a larger income.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Deisy Fiorella

texts.es:
Deisy es una joven de 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad en la cual se destaca por su población de origen afroperuano, es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, por sus hermosas playas, también esta ciudad es muy conocida por su comida ya que los pobladores de esa ciudad se les conoce por la buena sazón que tienen. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “arroz chaufa con wantan frito”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro estudiar la carrera Técnica de Contabilidad y gracias a ello logro conseguir empleo en un hospedaje en el cual trabaja actualmente, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diariamente y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y honrada.

Deisy está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejora en su vivienda refacción de paredes agrietadas y mejoramiento de cañerías de cocina, ya que el agua se filtra y poco a poco ha ido deteriorando las paredes; de esta manera ella podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo seguir esforzándose para poder ahorrar para poder cumplir su más grande sueño” Estudiar en la universidad y apoyar a su madre”.
texts.en:
Deisy is a young woman of 28. She lives in the city of Chincha, which is noted for its people of Afro-Peruvian origin, for being the cradle of great glories of Peruvian sports, and for its beautiful beaches. It is also very well known for its food, since the people of this city are known for their good seasonings. When Deisy has some free time, she very much likes to read and above all to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, which is the very delicious Chinese-style fried rice with fried wontons.

With great effort and dedication, she has managed to study for a career in technical accounting, and thanks to this she succeeded in obtaining employment in a guest house where she works now. She works about 8 hours a day, and with the fruit of her labor she can help her mother with the household expenses. She feels that she is doing well in her work because she is responsible and honest.

Deisy is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they have offered her, she will be able to complete some improvements in her home -- refinish the cracked walls and improve the plumbing in the kitchen, since the water leaks and little by little it has deteriorated the walls. In this way she will be able to have a better quality of life and above all to continue striving to save to able to complete her greatest dream: "to study in the university and to help her mother."

loans.use: to make improvements in her home

loans.name: Savry's Group

texts.en:
Savry is 56 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice to make a living, and now the current business earns her family about 26,000 KHR per day to spend for expenses. As a rice farmer, the main challenge for her is the lack of working capital to better support her business. 

Savry's group consists of two members and they both have been members of VisionFund for four cycles already. The past loans have helped Savry improve her livelihood and she managed to have some savings for the future. Now applying for a loan with VisionFund, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her paddy field and pay for labor. She hopes to make more healthy rice so as to better her living condition.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for labor

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 38-year-old woman who is married and has four children. She has worked as a retailer in the restaurant field for the past two years. Thanks to her warm customer service and the good quality of her dishes, she has acquired a large customer base, and her customers are becoming more demanding.

As she has low turnover, Amina can no longer satisfy her customers’ varied requests. This loan will allow her to diversify and increase the quantity of the foodstuff she uses to prepare her dishes. She will reinvest some of this additional profit in her business and will use the rest to provide for her family.

loans.use: buy foodstuff to prepare dishes for sale

loans.name: Akutay Fish Seller Group

texts.en:
Fatty is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  She was born in Kenema City 29 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has 2 children, 1 is attending primary school and the other is in secondary school. For many years now, Fatty has been selling fresh fish. 

This is first loan that Fatty and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Fatty will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business, she will buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Vang's Group

texts.en:
Vang is aged 56 and widowed with two children.  She lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. For the last twenty years, she has been growing eggplants and sometimes she works for others for a fee to earn extra income. The current business earns her about 16,400 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Vang's group of two with VisionFund. She is leading another member to apply for a loan of 700,000 KHR and 800,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, Vang is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her current business and use a portion of it to spend for gasoline to pump  water for her eggplants. She hopes to increase her business and sell her crops for a good price to make her living better.

loans.use: buy seeds and fuel for her water pump

loans.name: Burikhon

texts.en:
Burikhon is married and has two children. She is a person who always tries to improve her living conditions. With this aim, six years ago she began her own business in animal husbandry. Now, she is one of the best and most successful businesswomen in the local market. 

She buys cattle, cares of them for two or three months and sells to local people. Thanks to her care, her cattle are fat and attract a lot of customers. 

She wants to buy more cattle for developing her business, but she does not have money for it. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy cattle. In this way, she will provide her family with a high quality of living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso es originario de El Balsamo una comunidad en las afueras de Teustepe  es acompañado, padre de 3 hijos de 14,12 y4 años de edad respectivamente uno estudia sexto grado. Desafortunadamente Narciso no estudio porque  su padre no le gustaba que estudiara pero el busco la manera de aprender a leer y escribir. Empezó a trabajar con su padre a la edad de 8 años en el campo, sembrando, pues  es el oficio que se les enseña para conseguir ingresos demás de ser el alimento diario para la familia. Cuando la temporada de siembra esta baja el se va a realizar trabajos fuera de Nicaragua viaja a Costa Rica  en busca de trabajos de campo y limpieza de terrenos. Su gran anhelo es hacer producir sus siembras de frijoles y lograr tener ganado, ya que sus prioridad es el bienestar de sus familia, donde les pueda dar una mejor calidad de vida.  
Solicito el préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes, mano de obra para sembrar frijoles. Este crédito le será de gran ayuda pues espera sacar una  mejor producción y tener más ingresos. Mejorar su casita humilde para darles un mejor lugar donde vivir a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Narciso is originally from El Balsamo, a community on the outskirts of Teustepe. He has a partner, and he is the father of three children, ages 14, 12, and 4. One is in the sixth grade. Unfortunately, Narciso did not go to school because his father did not like him to study, but he sought a way to learn to read and write. He began to work with his father at the age of 8, planting in the fields, since this is the work that he was taught in order to obtain income in addition to producing daily food for the family. When it is the low season for planting, he leaves to work outside of Nicaragua. He travels to Costa Rica in search of work on farms and clearing land. His great desire is bring his plantings of beans into production and manage to have livestock, since his priority is the well-being of his family and giving them a better quality of life.

He is applying for the loan to buy compost and fertilizer and pay for labor to plant beans. This loan will be of great help, since he hopes to obtain better production and have more income, so that he can improve his humble little house to give his children a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers and pay for labor to plant beans.

loans.name: Okemer

texts.en:
Okemer is 27 years old and lives in the town of Likoni in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Okemer has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, posho and other foodstuffs.

To help expand her business, Okemer has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more rice, bales of wheat and maize flour, and sodas, among other basic items. This will help Okemer to generate greater profits and increase her daily income, since more stock will be added to her shop. Okemer hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, bales of wheat and maize flour, and sodas, among other basic items.

loans.name: Kholmurod

texts.en:
Kholmurod is an industrious person who is married and has five children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five years. Little by little, with the passing of the time, he has perfected his knowledge each year. Thanks to the animals' good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers.

Kholmurod is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way, he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
